loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 36 years old, a very active and efficient lady who performs her household tasks very well by staying at home. She is the mother of seven children, one of whom works, while the others are studying in a local school. Shahnaz is unable to provide education facilities for all of her children due to financial constraints.

Shahnaz's husband operates a horse cart through which he offers loading services to his clients and earns income for the family. He wants to buy a young horse because his horse has grown old and cannot run with heavy loading material on it.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. She is hopeful that by purchasing a young horse, her husband will be able to run his business better, offering better quality loading services to his customers and increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy a horse for her husband's loading business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 25-year-old married woman with three children; one of them is in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for six years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy raw materials for detergent and floor polish making.

loans.name: Review Jascar

texts.en:
Jascar, aged 29 years-old, is married to Geoffrey and they are blessed with one 12 year-old child. She runs a grocery stall that has been in operation for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.12,000.

This is her first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  She will use the funds to buy groceries such as onions, carrots, cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

Jascar hopes to educate her child and open another grocery in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nteteyia

texts.en:
Nteteyia is 42 years-old and has five children. To earn a living, she makes and sells traditional beaded jewellery.  She also sells fabric.  Previously, she used to sell milk.  Through Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to run her business well because she has been trained on business management skills.

Nteteyia has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy beads.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr:
Adole est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un réparateur. Elle a 2 enfants.
Adole travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend des pagnes et des articles en plastique pour tous clients, ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Sa difficulté est le fait de se promener pour servir ses clients.
Adole a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus et des articles en plastique. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adole voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité en ouvrant une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adole is 41 years old, married to a repairer and the mother of 2 children. She has been working as a retailer since 2006. She is a travelling saleswoman and sells pagnes (traditional sarong-like clothing) and plastic products to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Her biggest challenge is all the walking she has to do to in order to serve her customers.

Adole is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can invest in her business and buy fabric for pagnes and plastic products for resale. In the coming years, she would like to open a shop and increase her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 30-year-old married woman with four children; all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for three years.

Regina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He has engaged in farming for eight straight years and currently produces milk and eggs for the local market. He is aged 37 and married with six children; three are already going to school.

Boaz has requested a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds for his business. Boaz says will be able to make better returns with the loan since he has acquired more skills in managing poultry because he has been in it for eight years. He is optimistic to get enough income to improve his family's living standards and grow the business to the ranks of the leading suppliers in the area.

He does, however, note that poultry diseases are challenging to deal with in the business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Mrs. Kin is 40 years-old and a responsible mother of four children, living in Prey Chor district. She is in the same business as her husband, cultivating rice crops within each season of the year.  

This time, for a second loan, she is borrowing KHR1,500,000. She plans to use the loan to buy stocks of cashew nuts from her local villagers’ plantations. This project will create a good income for the family later.

With the increase of her income, Kin will use it to expand her businesses and she hopes to uplift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 30-year-old married woman with one child who is not yet in school. She has had a business of selling food items in Kator, South Sudan, for four years.

Flora is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru: Мансур женат и имеет двое детей. Жена занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Дети ходят в школу. Мансур является мастером и занимается производством окон и дверей. Он имеет четверых работников в качестве учеников, которых обучает своей профессии. В месяц обрабатывает 4-5 метр кубов доски. Он имеет хорошую репутацию среди клиентов и работников. Мансур хотел бы получить займ для покупки материалов и досок.
texts.en: Mansur is married and has two children. His wife is engaged in retail in the central town market. The children go to school. Mansur is a carpenter and has been manufacturing windows and doors. He has four employees as apprentices whom he teaches his profession. He processes four to five meter cubes  of boards a month. He has a good reputation among customers and employees. Mansur wants to get a loan for the purchase of materials and boards.

loans.use: to buy materials and boards.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mrs. Roth, age 49 years-old, is engaged in doing farming and making baskets to generate her income. She is a widow living with five children in Prey Chor district. At present, three of her children are already married and live independently while the other two are still dependent on her. 

Roth is seeking for her second loan from Kiva in order to purchase a stock of rice from the villagers who recently have just finished harvesting their rice. She will keep it as daily food within the year. She is very thankful for the funds given to her to solve her living needs.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loans.name: Nurabat

texts.ru: Нурабату 27 лет, женат, воспитывает одного ребенка. Нурабат рано стал главным кормильцем семьи из 5 человек - заботливым сыном для больной матери и  хорошим наставником для младших брата и сестры. Основным источником дохода для семьи Нурабата является животноводство. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Нурабата, его хозяйство  сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Нурабат обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребенка. Доходы от кредита Нурабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurabat is 27 years old, he is married and has one child. Nurabat became the main breadwinner of the family of five early being a caring son for his sick mother and a good mentor for younger brothers and sisters. The main source of income for Nurabat's family is livestock. Because of Nurabat's tenacity and perseverance today his business brings about 4,000 som (KGS) a month from the sales of meat and dairy products. In order to further increase the number of livestock Nurabat has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy a colt. Nurabat plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase in the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 24-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for one year.

Mary is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem, age 31 years-old, is a local farmer in Prey Chor district.  She is married and her husband works in the same type of business in Prey Chor district. She is also skilled in making bamboo baskets. This couple spends most of their time for work because they don’t have a child yet. Together, they typically earn an average of 2.5 per day from farming.

Presently they have had some difficulties in travelling as they don’t own a motorcycle for use. So now Choem decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase a used motorcycle for her family and work. She hopes that she’ll be able to build and expand her farming business and pursue a better standard of living one day.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed, plus ground nuts for peanut butter making

loans.name: Gulkayir

texts.ru:
Гулкайыр  проживает в селе Жаны-Арык на севере Кыргызстана со своей семьей с тремя детьми, младшей из которых семь лет. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Гулкайыр  с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 2003 году. На сегодняшний день,   Гулкайыр  в своем хозяйстве имеет 1 дойную корову, 5 овец, 1 бычка и 5 коз; продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В свободное время,   Гулкайыр  занимается рукоделием – изготавливает подушки, одеяла, что также является небольшим доходом в бюджет семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Гулкайыр  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы   Гулкайыр  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем намерена заняться реконструкцией дома.
texts.en: Gulkayir lives in the Zhany-Aryk village in northern Kyrgyzstan together with her family of three children, the youngest of whom is seven years old.  Much like many other rural families, she and her husband fatten up livestock, after starting this business in 2003.  Today, Gulkayir's business has one dairy cow, five sheep, one bull and five goats.  Sales of milk, dairy products and meat allows her to earn about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  Gulkayir is also involved in craftsmanship in her free time.  She makes pillows and blankets, which also serve as a small income for the family's budget.  In order to further grow her business, Gulkayir requested a loan in the sum of 40,000 som (KGS) form the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for the purchase of sheep to fatten up and resell.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock headcount.  In the future, she plans to get involved in making repairs to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional motor oil to sell

loans.name: Sayidjafar

texts.ru: Сайдчафар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 52 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Уже четыре года как занимается скотоводством. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Sayidjafar lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 52 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Sayidjafar is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la de ciudad de Itá, tiene un taller de autos en su barrio hace más de 5 años. Comenta que gracias a los años que lleva en esto ya pudo formarse una clientela bien definida.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que lucha por ayudar a su familia y de esa forma tengan un mejor estilo de vida. Comenta que le gustaría poder seguir creciendo y ampliando su local hasta tener un taller bien grande y que de más comodidades a sus clientes.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas con las cuales podrá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 38 years old and lives in the city of Itá. For more than 5 years, he has had an auto shop in his neighborhood. He says that he was able to build a solid clientele thanks to the years he has spent doing this work.

He defines himself as a very hard-working person who sacrifices and fights to help his family so that they may have a better lifestyle. He says that he would like to keep growing and expanding his premises until his workshop is pretty big and more comfortable for his customers.

He is asking for the loan to buy tools, with which he will be able to provide better service to his customers. He thanks the foundation for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his workshop

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru: Бунавша жительница города Куляб. Замужем. Возраст, 40 лет. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для закупа сезонного товара.
texts.en: Bunavsha is a resident of the city of Kulob.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in selling children's clothing.  Bunavsha is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 36 years old, married to Joshua and they have three children. She has been in the retail business for the last 3 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes10,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She plans to use the funds to buy sugar, rice, beans, maize flour and kerosene to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, maize flour, and kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличон занимается развозкой людей по маршруту Куляб – Душанбе. В этой области он три года. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Alijon is involved in transporting passengers along the Kulob - Dushanbe route.  He has been in this business for three years.  Alijon is 31 years old, married and has two children.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El Sr. Herminio es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 38 años de edad y está casado hace más de 6 años con la Sra. Antonia, ellos tienen 1 hijo de 4 años de edad.
Hace más de 20 años él Sr. Herminio se dedica a la  compra y venta de coco con su padre, en cada cosecha le deja muy buenas ganancias. Gracias a este trabajo logró comprarse un camión y trabajar en forma independiente, hoy en día ya tiene clientela formada, lo cual le trae muy buenas ganancias.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra  de coco puesto que ya comenzó la cosecha y necesita de capital para invertir en dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Herminio is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is 38 years old and has been married for more than 6 years to Señora Antonia.  They have one child who is 4 years old.  

Señor Herminio has been buying and selling coconut with his father for more than 20 years.  Their earnings are good for each harvest.  Thanks to this work he has been able to buy himself a truck and work independently.  Now he has an established clientele and brings in a good income.  

He is requesting a loan to buy coconut since the harvest has started and he needs capital to invest in his business.

loans.use: purchase coconut to sell.

loans.name: Buuraima

texts.ru: Буурайма  проживает в селе Кичи Айдаркен  на юге Кыргызстана со своей семьей с четыремя детьми, младшему из которых один год. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Буурайма с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 2001 году. Начав со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS), Буурайма на сегодняшний день  в своем хозяйстве имеет 4 головы дойных коров, что позволяет получать около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.  В целях увеличения удоя и дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Буурайма обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы   Буурайма  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Buuraima lives in the Kichi Aydarken village in the south of Kyrgyzstan together with her family of four children, the youngest of whom is one years old.  Much like many other families in the rural locale, Buuraima and her husband fatten up livestock, after starting this business in 2001.  Having used an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS) to start the business, today the business has four dairy cows, which allows Buuraima to earn about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of dairy products.  In order to increase milk production and further expand her business, Buuraima requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase dairy cows.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Assane  évolue dans les finances : il est comptable de profession. Il est âgé de 30 ans marié et pas encore d’enfant. Il est responsable et gère sa petite famille en réglant la dépense quotidienne Assane travaille dans le domaine des finances  depuis quatre ans. Avec le crédit il va élaborer des travaux de construction.
Dans l’ avenir il aimerait poursuivre ses études .
texts.en:
Mr. Assane deals with financial matters: he is an accountant by profession. He is 30 years old, married and no children yet.

He is a responsible person and supports his family by handling daily expenditures. Assane has been working in finance for four years.

The loan will enable him to undertake construction work. In the future he would like to pursue his studies.

loans.use: undertake construction work

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
La señora Lucina tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Luciano, tienen hijos pequeños y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en de la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Lucina se dedica desde hace tiempo a realizar trabajos de jardinería, tiene mucha clientela de su barrio y de los demás barrios de la ciudad, siempre se le contrata porque realiza buen trabajo y es conocida en la zona. Comenta que su esposo es asalariado, trabaja en la Municipalidad de Encarnacion por lo tanto también aporta ingresos al hogar, además que en su tiempo libre ayuda a su esposa en el trabajo de jardinería. Gracias a que ambos son personas trabajadoras ellos pueden mantener su hogar, educar a sus hijos y cubrir todos los gastos que requiere la casa.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de fertilizantes, corta pastos y demás insumos necesarios de jardinería.
texts.en:
Lucina, 37, has been married to Luciano for a long time and they have two small children; they live in their own home located in the city of Encarnación.

Lucina has been providing gardening services for quite some time.  She has quite a few customers in her neighborhood and in other neighborhoods in the city.  She gets hired always because she does good work and is well known in the zone.  She comments that her husband is a salaried employee working for the City of Encarnación so he too contributes to household income.  Besides, in his free time he helps his wife with the gardening.  Thanks to their both being workers, they are able to support their household, provide schooling for their children and cover all the required household expenses.

She asks the Fundación and Kiva for help to buy fertilizer, lawn mowers and other needed gardening supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and lawn mowers.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is the mother of five children, ranging in age from 2 to 14 years. She has been engaged in mixed farming in her rural home for 5 years. Her maize and vegetable produce are sold within the local markets. She is also a dealer in second-hand clothes.

Dinah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into dairy farming by buying and insuring a dairy cow. She says the cow's milk will help supplement family meals as well as boost her income to meet other needs. She also hopes she will be able to start a poultry business and to expand her farm. Dinah, however, laments the high cost of farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 37 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, she runs a school. She has employed three people in the school. She was able to open a school because she has good experience in teaching because she is a teacher. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money and run her business well. Catherine has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to build more classrooms.

loans.use: To build classrooms

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roberto tiene 39 años de edad, esta acompañado con la Sra. Ramona de 22 años de edad, tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijos.
El Sr. Roberto se dedica al comercio hace 5 años, en la venta de ropas y calzados usados en su domicilio,nos cuenta que pudo emprender su negocio con un ahorro con el cual contaba y de esa manera pudo ir acrecentando su negocio. Roberto es un señor muy trabajador y tiene como anhelo la de ir desarrollando su negocio día a día para poder brindarles una vida digna a sus hijos y a su esposa, ya que ellos son la razón de su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser shorts, remeras, pantalones, camisillas, como así también de calzados para poder revender. Agradece esta oportunidad que se le está dando.
texts.en: Roberto, 39, is accompanied by Ramona, 22, and they are happy to have two children.  Roberto has been a merchant for five years.  He sells used clothes and shoes at home.  He tells us that he was able to start his business with some savings he had and that’s how he’s been able to gradually increase his business.  Roberto is a very hardworking man who hopes to develop his business every day to provide his children and his wife with a dignified life since they are the reason for all his effort and sacrifice.  He asks for help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy all types of clothes like shorts, t-shirts, pants, shirts as well as footwear to resell.  He is grateful for the opportunity he’s being given.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and used shoes to resell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 40 years old and has been in farming for 10 years. She produces bananas, cabbages and French beans for the local market. She is married with three children aged 20, 16 and 13 years old.

Selina has requested for a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy. She says the income will be used to pay for the education of the children. She plans to buy high yield dairy cows as her business grows.

She is full of praise for Juhudi Kilimo with the loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more kale seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a business-man who owns semi-permanent rental houses made of iron sheets. He has been earning a living from his rental houses for eight years. Through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills, he has grown his business. Alfred needs a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to build more rental houses.

loans.use: to build more rental houses

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is 37 years old. She lives in Vanadzor city with her two daughters, who are students. For over six years Syuzanna has been running her own business: clothing sales in a rented shop. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes and house slippers, which she buys weekly from Yerevan. 
Thanks to her business income Syuzanna keeps her family and pays for her children's education. This is Syuzanna’s seventh loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments. Her first Kiva loan Syuzanna used to buy spring season clothes to resell. Now Syuzanna is seeking a 400.000 AMD loan to buy winter sweaters and holiday blouses and dresses before New Year’s holiday.

loans.use: to buy winter sweaters and holiday blouse and dresses before New Year’s holiday

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more computers for commercial use.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Хайринисо занимается 10 лет. Она замужем. Ей 58 лет. У нее трое детей. Она берет кредит для закупа бычков и телят.
texts.en: Khayriniso earns her living by breeding cattle. She has been engaged in this activity at her home for ten years. She is 58 years old, married, and has three children. Khayriniso is taking the loan to purchase bulls and calves.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 38 years old and married to Julius. They have four children.

She has been involved in her clothing business for the last 10 years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy more clothing materials for sewing and selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for sewing and selling

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам молодой перспективный юноша. Он женат. Детей пока не имеет. Несколько лет он был на заработках в России. На накопленный капитал купил землю. Отец у него дехканин. Он хочет создать для себя хорошие условия. Наладить бизнес и никуда не выезжать на заработки. Он на данный момент занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Так как он проживает в аграрном регионе на сельхозкультуры большой спрос. Он хочет получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли и ее подготовки к весеннему посеву. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
Спасибо.
texts.en:
Rustam is a promising young man. He is married. He does not have children yet. For several years he worked in Russia. For the accumulated money he purchased land. His father is a farmer. 

Rustam wants to create good conditions for himself, to establish business and don't have to travel anywhere for work. He is currently growing crops. As he lives in an agricultural area there is a high demand for it. He wants to get a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers for cultivation of the land and preparation for spring planting. He hopes for your support. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, esta casada con el Sr.Publio hace 15 años, no tienen hijos, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace mas de 20 años.
La señora Gloria nos comenta que se dedica a la costura hace 15 años. Cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque solo ella trabaja en la familia. Uno de sus sueños es comprar mas maquinas para trabajar y así progresar cada día mas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de Telas, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Gloria, 43, is a very hardworking woman.  She’s been married to Publio for fifteen years; they have no children.  They have lived in the city of Coronel Oviedo for more than 20 years.

Gloria comments that she’s been working sewing for 15 years.  She relates that her work is very demanding because she’s the only one in her family who works.  One of her dreams is to buy more machines to work and progress more each day.

She asks for a loan to buy fabric to be able to continue filling customer orders.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 23 years old and a single mother with two children.

She has been into her business for the last 4 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more clothes and venture in a charcoal business to help educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale and stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Fodelina hace 26 años, tienen 7 hijos, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace mas de 20 años.
El Sr. Sergio es comerciante hace cinco años, montó una pequeña despensa y venta de bebidas. Comenta que anteriormente se dedicaba de lleno a la agricultura con varios tipos de cultivos para sobrevivir, pero eso  ya no era suficiente para mantener a su familia, y decidió montar su negocio con algunos ahorros. Esta orgulloso de su labor porque ya tiene hijos que formaron su propia familia y a los demás les sigue ofreciendo todo el cuidado y la educación que ellos necesitan. Su sueño es tener una Casa de Bebidas bien surtida ya que él es el único con ese tipo de negocio en su zona.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de Bebidas como ser cervezas, vinos, y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sergio, 46, has been married to Fodelina for 26 years and they have seven children; they have lived in the city of Coronel Oviedo for more than 20 years.

Sergio has been a merchant for five years.  He set up a small store and sells beverages.  He comments that he used to work full-time farming various types of crops to survive but it wasn’t sufficient any more to support his family and he decided to set up a business with some savings he had.  He is proud of his work because he now has children who have formed their own families and he continues to provide education and care needed by the other ones.  His dream is to have a well-stocked beverage store since his is the only business of this type in his zone.  

He’s asking for the loan to buy beverages like beer, wines and others to stock his store and continue to offer a wide variety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years old and a single mother of a five-year-old child. To earn a living, she provides mobile phone money-transfer services. She has been in this business for five years and has employed five people. She also does farming to supplement her income.

Catherine hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to add float for her phone business.

loans.use: to add float for her mobile phone business

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухроб потомственный пекарь. Его отец тоже работает пекарем. У них свой лепешечный цех. Их лепешки знамениты и востребованы в городе. Более пяти лет он тоже занимается данным бизнесом. Сухроб женат и имеет одного ребенка. Для продвижения своего бизнеса он хочет получить займ. Выпечка лепешек приносит удовольствие и радость. Ведь если дома насыщенный хлеб, значит все хорошо. Он хотел бы получить займ  в размере 10 000 сомони для оптового закупа муки и угля. Он надеется в вашей поддержке в получении займа
texts.en: Suhrobjon comes from a family of bakers and operates a flatbread bakery with his father. Their flatbreads are famous and in demand in the city. Suhrobjon has been in this business for over five years. He is married and has a child. In order to advance his business, Suhrobjon would like to obtain a loan. Baking flatbreads is fun and rewarding. After all, if there is good bread in the house, then all is well. Suhrobjon would like to receive a loan of 10000 somoni to make a bulk purchase of flour and coal. He is hoping for your support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal

loans.name: Review-Joseph

texts.en:
Review-Joseph is 58 years old and is supporting four children.

He has been involved in his retail business for the last 16 years, from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 37,000. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 30,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy maize, wheat flour and kerosene for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El señor Virgilio tiene 50 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, tiene una olería hace mas de 12 años. Nos comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio ya que tiene una vasta experiencia, lo cual lo ayuda mucho.
El cuenta que se esfuerza mucho para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma poder sentirse útil. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y agrandar su olería, dando de esa forma fuentes de trabajo a otras personas que al igual que el desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Virgilio solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación para la compra de barro y arcilla, las cuales son las principales materias primas que utiliza. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le esta dando para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 50, lives in the city of Itá; he’s had a brick factory for more than 12 years.  He tells us that he does very well in the business because he has vast experience which helps him quite a bit.

He relates that he works very hard to be able to help with household expenses to feel useful this way.  One of his dreams is to be able to continue growing and expanding his brick factory providing sources of employment to others who also want to get ahead and help their families.

Virgilio is asking for help from Kiva and the Fundación to buy clay and mud which are the main raw materials he uses.  He is grateful for the opportunity he’s being given to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy clay and mud.

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis is 31 years old and a single mother of one. To earn a living, she runs a grocery. She has been in the business for 12 years. She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination. Her desire is to open another outlet of her business in the future.

Fidelis needs a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 51-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children. She has been selling tomatoes in an open air market for the past seven years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced to it by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy tomatoes for her stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza es la ciudad de Lambaré, está constituido por 17 mujeres, quienes se unieron la esperanza de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas están con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, tiene fe de que el programa de la fundación les ayudará mucho, es por ello que se esfuerzan al máximo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Claudia, quien nos cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, la cual tiene hace un buen tiempo. Gracias a su negocio y a su empeño ella puede ayudar a su familia y de esa forma darles todo lo que necesitan para poder salir adelante. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y ser una gran comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como ser, panificados, carnes, lácteos, aceites, embutidos, fideos entre otros, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” committee is from the city of Lambaré; it’s composed of 17 women who joined together to help their families through their joint work.  They very much want to get ahead and to make progress.  They have faith that the Fundación’s program will help them a lot and this is why they make the maximum effort.

One of the women is Claudia who tells us that she has a very well-stocked store that she’s had for a good length of time.  Thanks to her store and her efforts she’s able to help her family and give them everything they need to get ahead.  One of her dreams is to be able to continue to grow and be a great merchant.

She asks for the loan to buy basic staple items like baked goods, meat, dairy products, oil, canned goods and noodles, among others, to stock up and offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 35 years old, married and has two children. For five years, she has been operating a general shop. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management.

Jacinta hopes to open a wholesale business in the future. With a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings, she will buy beans and maize.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is 30 years old and married to Andrew. They have three children.

She has been in the photo business for the last 3 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 50,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 20,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to upgrade the studio section of her business and to open up more photo studios in the future.

loans.use: to upgrade her studio

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru: Тутинисо более девяти лет занимается продажей женских тканей. Она товар приобретает за пределами страны и старается расширить свой бизнес. Она разведенная и детей не имеет. Она начала свой бизнес с продажи детской обуви и одежды,  торговля детскими вещами приносила ей радость. Она радовалась когда дети радостными уходили приобретя нужную вещь. А потом перешла на продажу женских тканей для того, чтобы получить побольше прибыли. Она хочет получить займ в размере $3000 США для приобретения нового товара  к Новому году. Она хочет пополнить свой ассортимент и получить больше прибыли от торговли под Новый год. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку спасибо!
texts.en:
Tutiniso has worked with selling children's clothing and shoes for more than ten years. She acquires her products outside the country and tries to expand her business. She is divorced, and does not have children, but trading children's clothes and shoes brings her joy. She is happy when children leave happy, having purchased necessary clothing. Then Tutiniso switched to women's clothing trade to achive higher profit margins. 

Tutiniso wants to receive a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars for the purchase of new inventory for the New Year's celebration. She wants to expand her inventory and supplement her product range to make profits from trade on the New Year's celebration and gift giving season. She hopes to get help and thanks for the support.

loans.use: to buy merchandise supplementing the current product range of women's clothing

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 42 years old and is married to John. They have one child.

She has been in the retail business for the last 4 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more motorbike spare parts and secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité MUJERES TRABAJADORAS, está constituido por  19 señoras quienes se encuentran luchando dia a dia por llevar a sus hogares el pan de cada dia. Todas son mujeres jefas de familia, muy sacrificadas y luchadoras.
Tal así el caso de la sra. Deolinda, quien está casada y se dedica a la venta y compra de fideos, leche, bebidas, ropas, artículos de bijouterie; una vez adquirido estas mercaderías lo vuelve a vender. Y con los venta adquirida puede mantener a su familia y mantener un negocio bastante exitoso en su barrio. Unos de los tantos sueños de la sra. Deolinda es poder contar con una despensa y convertirse en una microempresaria más exitosa de lo que ya ha podido convertirse en este corto tiempo que se unió a la fundación.
Ella es una señora muy emprendedora ya que se dedica a variadas cosas, en lo cual le va muy bien, es por ello que solicita el crédito para poder abastecerse con fideos, leche, bebidas y demás artículos de primera necesidad, lo cual le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) committee has 19 members who struggle daily to provide daily bread for their homes.  All of the women are heads of household who are very self-sacrificing and tenacious.

Such is the case of Deolinda who is married and buys and sells noodles, milk, beverages, clothes, costume jewelry.  Once she acquires these goods she resells them.  With profits she’s able to support her family and maintain quite a profitable business in her neighborhood.  One of Deolinda’s many dreams is to have a store and to become a more successful micro businesswoman than what she’s managed to become in the short time since she joined the Fundación.

She is a very enterprising woman who does a variety of things and does well in them.  Because of this, she’s asking for a loan to buy noodles, milk, beverages and other basic staple items that will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, beverages and other items to resell.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 42-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 6 children between the ages of 28 and 6.  All of them go to school. 

Jacob runs a food store business, and he has been in this business for 3 years. He has 1 employee. Jacob heard about Finance Sudan from outreach and promotion done in the market by the loan officer. He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase more items like soda, milk, drinking water, and many others. In addition to this business, Jacob has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Jacob would like to build a house and increase the number of goods if not open another shop. His major challenges include the low income rate and high standard of living in Juba. Jacob says that he appreciates finance Sudan for considering men too for the loans because some of the MFIs consider women only.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soda, milk, drinking water, and many others.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 25-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Sabina is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Killion

texts.en:
Killion was born in 1983. He is married and has three children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  He has retained his business because he has a good reputation with his customers.

Killion hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, soda and tea leaves.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, soda, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables, potatoes, cabbages, and onions for sale.

loans.name: Rosesina

texts.en:
Rosesina is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. Three of the children are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Rosesina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and a single mother of three children.

She has been in the business for the last 10 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy cabbages, fruits, potatoes, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La Sra. Evarista, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, está casada con el Sr. Modesto con quien tiene una hija de 22 años de edad.La Sra Evarista tiene una despensa bien surtida hace mas de 12 años, y nos comenta que cuenta con una clientela bien formada quienes se encuentran muy conformes con los precios y los productos que se encuentran a la venta en la despensa.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada que gracias a su esfuerzo y su perseverancia a logrado llevar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, ademas de su depensa logró montar una herrería donde trabajan su marido y su yerno.
La Sra. Evarista manifestó que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de Arroz, azúcar, panificados, lacteos, carnes, articulos de limpieza, etc. con lo cual podrá abastecer su despensa y de esa forma cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evarista, 46, lives in the city of Itá.  She’s married to Modesto and they have a 22-year-old daughter.  Evarista has had a well-stocked store for over 12 years and she comments that she has a well-established clientele who are very satisfied with her prices and with the products that are available at her store.

She is a very hardworking, self-sacrificing woman who thanks to her effort and perseverance has managed to move her family ahead and improve their quality of life.  In addition to her store, she managed to also open a hardware store where her husband and her son-in-law work.

Evarista stated that she is asking help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy rice, sugar, baked goods, dairy products, meat, cleaning supplies, etc. to stock her store to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда замужем. Имеет троих детей. Муж работает автослесарем. У них дружная семья. Они стараются работать лучше для улучшения своих жилищных условий. У неё свой магазин с продуктами. Она закупает товар на рынке. У нее свой круг клиентов, которых она рада обслужить. Она хочет получить займ в размере 3000 долларов США  для  расширения ассортимента своих товаров. Ведь к праздникам торговля будет хорошей. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Mavjuda is married and has three children. Her husband works as a car mechanic. Everyone in their family gets along well with each other. Mavjuda and her husband are trying to work harder to improve their living conditions. Mavjuda has her own food store, which she stocks with products from the market. She has her regular customers whom she is always happy to serve. Mavjuda would like to obtain a loan in the amount of $3000 in order to expand the assortment of her products, since trade will be brisk during the holidays. She is hoping for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more food products for her store

loans.name: Loko Paul

texts.fr: Loko Paul est âgé de 56 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Mahoussi. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Loko Paul n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Loko Paul est un meunier qui exerce cette activité depuis vingt trois ans environs. Parallèlement à cette  activité, Loko Paul vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile, ce qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. C'est dans sa région que Loko Paul s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Loko Paul sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les trois premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Loko Paul ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Loko Paul is 56 years old and married to a merchant named Mahoussi. The couple has five children all in school and under their care. In addition to their children, the couple has another child under their care. Loko Paul didn't go to school. The couple takes care of their diverse family responsibilities together.

To meet the needs of himself and his family, Loko Paul is a miller and has been working in this business for about 23 years. At the same time as this business, Loko Paul sells firewood from home, which brings in not insignificant income for him. Loko Paul gets his supplies in his region.

With the goal of strengthening his business and better satisfying his clientèle, Loko Paul is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. His goal is to grow his business. The first three loans received by Loko Paul were properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood and spare parts.

loans.name: Ritia

texts.en:
Ritia is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling fish in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Ritia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married to John. They have three children.

She has been into the business for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 from her business. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more knitting wool, textile fabrics and to buy another knitting machine in the future.

loans.use: To buy knitting wool and textiles/fabrics

loans.name: Waliou Olakoudé

texts.fr: Waliou Olakoudé est âgé de 56 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Moudjibath. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Waliou Olakoudé a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Waliou Olakoudé exerce l’activité de meunier à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Dans le but de se ravitailler en pièces de rechange pour son moulin et en gasoil, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle dans un bref délai, Waliou Olakoudé sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Waliou Olakoudé s’approvisionne dans sa région. Les trois premiers crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Waliou Olakoudé is 56 years old and married to a merchant named Moudjibath. The couple has two children of whom one goes to school. In addition to their children, the couple has another child under their care. Waliou Olakoudé stopped going to school at the primary level. The couple takes care of their diverse family responsibilities together.

For about twenty years, Waliou Olakoudé has been working as a miller from home, which allows him to meet the needs of himself and his family. With the goal of getting fresh supplies of spare parts for his mill and diesel fuel, in order to better meet the requirements of his clientèle with a brief delay, Waliou Olakoudé is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fourth time. Waliou Olakoudé gets his supplies in his region. The first three loans previously received were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Unia

texts.en:
Unia is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 2 years old. Three of them go to school. 

Unia runs a clothing sales business. She has been in the business for six years. She has one employee. Unia heard about Finance Sudan through her fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items like shoes, T-shirts, women's wear and many others. In additions to this business, Unia has no other source of income.

In five years time, Unia would like to hope for an increment in the business size and to open another new business.

Her major challenges include school fees and home expenses. 

Unia says that, she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women, for helping us in South Sudan with capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes and T-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Gbenassou Gilbert

texts.fr: Gbenassou Gilbert est âgé de 46 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et à charge. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en dehors de leurs enfants. Gbenassou Gilbert vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Gbenassou Gilbert n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Depuis dix sept ans environs, Gbenassou Gilbert exerce l’activité de meunier dans un marché du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Gbenassou Gilbert  fait l’élevage de porcs dans sa région. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité par l’acquisition d’un nouveau moulin à maïs et des pièces de rechanges nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son moulin, Gbenassou Gilbert sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra certainement de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle dans un bref délai. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gbenassou Gilbert is 46 years old and married to a trader called Béatrice. The couple have 3 children, some of whom are going to school and are in their care. They are also raising another child who is not theirs. Gbenassou Gilbert lives together with his wife and children, and the couple both take care of the household expenses.

Gbenassou Gilbert did not go to school. He has been a miller for around 17 years and carries out his business in one of Benin´s markets. His income allows him to take care of his needs and those of his family. He also has a sideline business breeding pigs in his local area.

Gbenassou Gilbert is requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé in order to buy a corn mill and the necessary spare parts for it, so that he can increase his level of business activity. This loan will enable him to better fulfill customer demand within a short time period. He has fully repaid his 3 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy a corn mill and spare parts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old and married to Bernard. They have two children.

She has been into her business for the last three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from this business. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell and in the future, to have a stock of cereals.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in the small town of Gweru in Zimbabwe and she conducts her business of selling clothes in the same community. She has requested another loan of $800 to buy baby clothes and winter clothes for kids. This loan will enable her to increase her stock levels. Subsequently, her sales will also increase as will her income. With this extra income, she will be able to buy other goods for her home use. Florence says the challenge she faces is the shortage of capital.  Florence is planning to open a bigger shop to stock clothes for all age groups.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two school-aged children. With the cooperation of his wife, he was able to cover their heavy costs of life in addition to his children’s study fees. His wife has been working in a local company since 2003. As for him, he opened his own bakery inn 2004 and already has 15 years of experience in this job. Today, he wants to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to install a new curtain glass for his bakery. He notes that this will improve his place, which will allow him to attract more clients. In the future, he plans to renovate and expand his bakery.

loans.use: to install a new curtain glass for his bakery

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Stella is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 33-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents who are fulfilling and responding to the family needs. She started her own business in 2010, where she sells women accessories in addition to recharge cards. Today, she’s asking for a loan of $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her existing quantity of accessories and also to buy more recharge cards. This Kiva loan will increase her sales and therefore her profits. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop to include new and diverse items.

loans.use: to increase her existing quantity of accessories and also buy more recharge cards

loans.name: Virgen De Los Dolores Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Virgen del Dolores” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde este año mediante la promoción de una de las asesoras en el barrio. En total son 10 mujeres, quienes trabajan de forma unida y siempre dentro de un marco de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Una de las miembros es la señora Adalbina, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, en lo cual dice que le va muy bien. Ella cuenta que tiene muchos clientes, lo cual la ayuda a poder tener buenos ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Una de sus metas es poder crecer y seguir agrandando su local.Adalbina 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, licores y demás tipos de bebidas, con lo cual puede abastecerse y tener siempre productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Dolores” women’s committee started working with Fundación Paraguaya this year thanks to a promotion conducted by one of its promoters in the neighborhood.  There are 10 women in total who work together within a framework of respect and mutual help.

One of the members is Adalbina who tells us that she sells all types of beverages and says that she does quite well.  She relates that she has many customers which helps her earn good income and help her family.  One of her goals is to continue enlarging her locale.

She is asking for the loan to buy beer, wine, liquor and other types of beverages to stock up and always have products available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Madleine

texts.en: Madleine is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and five children who are still attending school. She collaborates with her husband, who has been working in a local school since 1988 in order to enhance their way of living. As for her, she has owned a bookstore for the past ten years. In parallel, she teaches in one of the local schools and has seven years of experience. Today, she’s looking to borrow $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a photocopy machine, stationary, and books for her bookstore. This will definitely develop her business and help her earn superior income. In the future, she plans to focus on one job and better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopy machine, stationary, and books for her bookstore

loans.name: Bo Elie

texts.fr: Bo Elie est âgé de 33 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Chantal. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Bo Elie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire, mais a appris le métier d’électronicien. Il y a environs dix sept ans que Bo Elie exerce cette activité; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de répondre aux exigences de sa famille. Parallèlement, Bo Elie vend des pièces électroniques dans son atelier. Bo Elie s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans le but de mieux équiper son atelier par l’acquisition de pièces électroniques pouvant lui permettre de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Bo Elie sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Bo Elie is 33 years old and married to a merchant named Chantal. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom go to school. In addition to their own children, they also have another child in their care. The couple handles together the various household responsibilities. 

Bo Elie attended primary school, then learned the trade of electronics technician. He has been working in this sector for approximately seventeen years, which has allowed him to support himself and his family. As a sideline, Bo Elie also sells electronics components in his workshop. 

Bo Elie buys his stock in Nigeria. He wants to be better equipped, which is why he is seeking a third loan from ALIDé to purchase electronic parts that will enable him to meet customer demand. The first two loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy electronic parts.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, not in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for 3 years.

Nadia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Lojuan

texts.en:
Lojuan is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 8 and 3. All of them go to school. 

Lojuan runs a clothing sales business and has been in the business for 6 years. He has one employee. Lojuan heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer's promotion done in the market. He is taking out a loan of SDG 2,000 to purchase more items like shoes, women wear, and others. In addition to this business, Lojuan has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Lojuan would like to build his own house.

His major challenges include the low income rate and high cost of living in Juba.

Lojuan says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s effort to help poor people like him with funding.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes and women wear

loans.name: Mahougnon Denise

texts.fr: Mahougnon Denise est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un meunier du nom de Yves. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mahougnon Denise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Mahougnon Denise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Mahougnon Denise mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs, la vente de condiments de sauce et divers autres articles (riz, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. C’est dans un marché du Bénin que Mahougnon Denise s’approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Mahougnon Denise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les trois  premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Mahougnon Denise  ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahougnon Denise is 33 years old and married to a miller called Yves. The couple have 3 children in their care, some of whom are in school. Mahougnon Denise lives together with her husband and children, and the couple both take care of the household expenses.

Mahougnon Denise did not go to school. In order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her family, she has been selling condiments for sauce and other food products, like rice and corn, from her home for around 10 years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin.

Mahougnon Denise is requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé so that she can restock on food products, strengthen her business and better respond to customer demand. Her goal is to increase her business. She has fully repaid her 3 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy sacs of corn and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, bracelets, necklaces, matemba, and wrist watches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes for making chips and crisps.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old and is married with three children who range from six to twenty-one years old. She is a determined woman. She has been involved with farming and selling kale for the past two years. She faces the challenge of inadequate funds to maintain the business. 

Alice will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy more kale and fertilizers. Her hope and dream is to expand her business and become a supplier for the big, nearby institutions such as the university in her home area in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and kale.

loans.name: Kintossou

texts.fr: Kintossou est âgé de 47 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Clautilde. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Kintossou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Kintossou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Depuis vingt deux ans environs, Kintossou exerce le métier d’électronicien. De façon secondaire, Kintossou vend des pièces électroniques. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Dans le but d’acquérir des pièces électroniques, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Kintossou sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Kintossou achète ses pièces au Nigéria. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Kintossou is 47 years old and married to a trader called Clautilde. The couple have 6 children, some of whom are attending school. They are also raising a 7th child who is not their own. Kintossou lives together with his wife and the children, and the couple both take care of the household expenses.

Kintossou left school during his secondary education and has been an electrician for around 22 years. He also has a sideline business selling electronic parts, which he gets in Nigeria. The income from his activities enables him to take care of his needs and those of his family.

Kintossou is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé in order to buy electronic parts, so that he is better able to satisfy his customer demand. He has fully repaid his 2 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy electronic parts and devices for resale.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 25-year-old, single woman who lives with her only parent and seven siblings. Six of them are working, and her brother is the one responding to his family's demands and covering their expenses. For this reason, Fatmeh decided to start her own home business to take some of the responsibilities off of her brother. She has been teaching private lessons since 2009. 

Today, she’s asking to borrow $1,300 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new computer, desk and a board in order to carry on her job in a proper way. In the future, she plans to join a local school and benefit from their experience.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer, desk and a board in order to carry on her job in a proper way.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene 65 años, está casado con la señora Emerenciana, juntos tienen 2 hijos. Juan es macatero (vendedor ambulante), desde muy joven se dedica a este trabajo por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo.
Realiza sus ventas por Gran Asunción, Villa Elisa, San Lorenzo, Capiata, desde muy joven macateaba con su papá, de quien aprendió a dedicarse a la venta. Ahora cuenta que gracias a este trabajo le dio educación a sus hijos, y que seguirá trabajando en esto por un tiempo más.
Solicita el crédito para compra de sábanas, colchas, sobrecamas, etc. los cuales son los principales productos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Juan is 65 years old and married to Emerenciana; they have two children.  Juan is a “macatero” (itinerant vendor); he’s been in this line of work since he was young so he has a lot of experience in it.

He carries out his sales in Gran Asunción, Villa Elisa, San Lorenzo and Capiata.  He’s been street selling since he was very young and worked with his father from whom he learned how to dedicate himself to sales.  He comments that now thanks to this work he was able to provide education for his children and that he will continue working at this for more time.

He is asking for the loan to buy sheets, bedspreads, comforters, etc. which are the main products he sells.  He thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads and comforters.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan for 5 years.

Amani is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Houénagnon Marcellin

texts.fr: Houénagnon Marcellin est âgé de 35 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Janviette. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Houénagnon Marcellin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure, activité qu’il exerce depuis cinq ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de répondre aux exigences de sa famille. Houénagnon Marcellin exerce cette activité dans son atelier. Dans le but de mieux équiper son atelier par l’acquisition de matériels de coiffure, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Houénagnon Marcellin sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Houénagnon Marcellin is 35 years old and married to a hairdresser called Janviette. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school. They are also raising a 3rd child who is not their own. Both parents contribute to the household expenses.

Houénagnon Marcellin left school during his primary education and learnt the hairdressing trade. He has been a hairdresser for 5 years and his income allows him to take care of his needs and meet the demands of his family.

Houénagnon Marcellin has his own hairdressing studio and is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé in order to restock his studio with new hairdressing products, so that he is better able to meet customer demand. His previous 2 loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing products.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 49-year-old Lebanese widowed woman. She has three children, one of whom is working. She strives to work really hard in order to offer them a better future. After fifteen years of experience in the trading field, she decided to start her own home business is 2007 where she sells clothes, shoes and lingerie. She works independently and has gained a fair number of shop owners who are looking to buy her products. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more clothes and other products for her business. She notes that this will help her develop her work and boost her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and other products for her business

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor Luis Carlos trabaja como agricultor desde hace 15 años y es esta actividad la que le permite conseguir los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento. Esta actividad la aprendió el señor Luis Carlos de la mano de su padre quien también era agricultor y quien falleció hace un año. Actualmente, el señor Luis Carlos tiene cultivo de maíz y fríjol en un terreno de la finca de sus padres la cual se encuentra en proceso de sucesión. Con la necesidad de mejorar su cultivo y superar las dificultades que se han presentado por la temporada invernal, el señor Luis Carlos requiere de la compra de insumos agrícolas para su cultivo como abonos y riegos. El señor Luis Carlos sueña con mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Carlos has been working as a farmer for 15 years and this activity has allowed him to bring in the income necessary to support himself.  He learned this work from his father who was also a farmer and who died a year ago.  Currently, Señor Luis Carlos grows corn and beans on his parents farm land that he is in the process of inheriting.  In order to improve his crops and overcome the difficulties he faced during the winter season, Señor Luis Carlos needs to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation supplies.  

Señor Carlos dreams of increasing his income so he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es:
Nemesio tiene 26 años, está casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en su casa de Carapeguá con su esposa Tomasa. Él fabrica pelotas y su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica. Nos cuenta que aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó mucho tiempo y lo puso en práctica a su corta edad.
Actualmente vende sus productos por Asunción. Decidió dedicarse al rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia  además de que le deja un buen ingreso económico. Es un señor muy trabajador, honesto y responsable. Son los valores que sus vecinos resaltan de el.
Necesita el crédito para la compra materias primas para la elaboración de productos, tales como cueros, hilos, etc. Cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y hacer llegar las pelotas que hace por todo el país.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 26 years old and married with two children. He lives in his house in Carapeguá with his wife Tomasa. He makes balls, and his wife works as a domestic employee. He tells us that he learned his work from his father, with whom he worked for a long time, and he put it into practice at his young age.

Currently he sells his products around Asunción. He decided to pursue the same line of work because he has experience in it, and it also provides him with good earnings. He is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible man. These are the values that his neighbors emphasize about him.

He needs the loan to buy raw materials to make his products, such as leather, thread, etc. He says that his dream is to continue growing and to be able to sell the balls he makes all over the country.

loans.use: to purchase leather and thread to make balls

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 38 years old and single. She describes herself as a determined woman. She has been running a general store for the last three years and sells vegetables such as kale, tomatoes, onions, etc. and charcoal. Her business challenge is the insufficient funds for maintaining her general store. She will use the loan of KES 15,000 to buy charcoal, onions and tomatoes. Ruth hopes to expand her business by increasing the inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Alexandre Vihanou

texts.fr: Alexandre Vihanou est âgé de 35 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Rosaline. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Alexandre Vihanou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Alexandre Vihanou mène comme activité depuis quatorze ans environs, la transformation. Alexandre Vihanou désire améliorer ses prestations et pour ce faire, Alexandre Vihanou voudrait acquérir des pièces de rechange (cylindre, vilebrequin, etc.) nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son activité.  Son ambition est d’augmenter la taille de son unité de transformation.  Pour cette raison,  Alexandre Vihanou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Alexandre Vihanou a bien remboursé les trois premiers crédits reçus de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Alexandre Vihanou is 35 years old and married to a hairdresser named Rosaline. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom go to school. In addition to their own children, they also have another child in their care. Alexandre Vihanou did not go to school. 

The couple handles together the various household responsibilities. In order to support himself and provide for his family, Alexandre Vihanou has been working in car transformation for about 14 years. Wanting to increase his revenue, he is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé to purchase spare parts (cylinders, crankshafts, etc.), which are necessary for the smooth operation of his activity.
