His goal is to expand his business. His first three credits were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (cylinders, crankshafts, etc.)

loans.name: Manis

texts.en:
Manis is a 30 year’s old businessman, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 9. All of the children go to school. 

Manis runs a clothing sales business. He has been in the business for 4 years. He has 1 employee. Manis heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 2000 to purchase more items like shoes, women's dresses, and many other items. Excepting this business, Manis has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Manis hopes to build a house for himself. His major challenges include low income and expensive goods. Manis says that he is 'appreciating Finance Sudan’s effort in helping us'.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes, women's dresses, and many other items.

loans.name: Sènana Marie

texts.fr: Sènana Marie est âgée de 53 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sènana Marie et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sènana Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sènana Marie mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la transformation. De façon secondaire, Sènana Marie vend des céréales, du charbon de bois et divers autres articles dans sa région. Sènana Marie s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sènana Marie  sollicite un quatrième crédit. Sènana Marie a bien remboursé les trois premiers crédits reçus de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sènana Marie is 53 years old and married to Louis. The couple are raising their 4 children, all of whom attend school, and they both contribute to the household expenses.

Sènana Marie did not go to school. In order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her family, she has been working in the processing industry for around 15 years. She also has a sideline business selling cereals, charcoal and various other products to local customers. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Sènana Marie is requesting a 4th loan in order to restock on supplies, so that she can better respond to customer demand and increase her level of business. She has fully repaid her 3 previous loans from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacs of corn, bags of charcoal and assorted items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed

loans.name: Wangninnou Ives

texts.fr: Wangninnou Ives est âgé de 31 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Denise. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Wangninnou Ives n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Wangninnou Ives exerce l’activité de meunier à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Dans le but de s’approvisionner en gasoil et d’acquérir des pièces de rechanges nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son moulin, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Wangninnou Ives sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Wangninnou Ives  achète ses pièces dans une ville du Bénin. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Wangninnou Ives is 31 years old and is married to a retail merchant named Denise. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school but all are dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple cares for another child. The couple shares responsibility in dealing with family expenses.

Wangninnou Ives has not attended school. For the past fifteen years he has been working as a miller out of his home, which enables him to meet his needs and those of his family. 

Having to purchase diesel fuel and spare parts to ensure the smooth functioning of his mill (he gets his spare parts from a city in Benin), and wanting to better meet the needs of his customers, Wangninnou Ives is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy spare parts and diesel fuel

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 30 years old and single with no children yet. He describes himself as a courageous man. Previously, he was involved in a grocery store activity. For the last two years, he has been providing taxi transportation services to frequent customers in a strategic and suitable place for the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a bicycle to increase his modes of transportation. His dream and hope is to own a transportation industry.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle

loans.name: Sekwat

texts.en:
Sekwat is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of 7 and 3 years old. All of them go to school. 

Sekwat runs a clothing sales business. He has been in the business for seven years. He has one employee. Sekwat heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer's promotion in the market. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items like women's dresses and many other items. In addition to this business, Sekwat has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Sekwat hopes to open two shops.

His major challenges include the low income rate and high price of goods.

Sekwat says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s effort in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items like women's dresses and many other items

loans.name: Abibatou  Adjokè

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Abibatou  Adjokè est mariée à Firmin un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abibatou  Adjokè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Abibatou  Adjokè a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Abibatou  Adjokè prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons) qu’elle vend dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Abibatou  Adjokè vend  des vêtements et sous-vêtements. Abibatou  Adjokè exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année. Abibatou  Adjokè s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élever le niveau de son activité, Abibatou  Adjokè sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
28 Years old, Abibatou Adjoké is married to Firmin, a carpenter. The couple has three children, all attending school and who are their dependents. Abibatou Adjoké lives together with her ​​husband and children.

Abibatou Adjoké left school at secondary level. To support herself and her children, she makes food preparations (corn dough accompanied by fish sauce) which she sells in her neighborhood. As a second source of income, she also sells clothes and under-garments.

Abibatou Adjoké has been carrying on her business for the past ten years. She resupplies in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and raise the level of her business activities, she is now requesting a fourth credit loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy bags of corn and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 8 años.
María se dedica a la venta de repuesto de carros, siempre tuvo el negocio, pero su capital era muy poco, ahora con Finca ella pudo crecer como negociante y como mujer, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder ser mejor esta muy feliz en Finca y trata siempre de cumplir con todo, agradece que con los ahorros pudo comprarse un terreno, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank. She has been a member of Finca Perú for 8 years.

Maria makes a living selling car parts. She has always had the business, but her capital was very small. Now with Finca she can grow as a businessperson and as a woman. The training helps her to be better. She is very happy with Finca and tries to always do everything that is asked of her. She is grateful that she was able to buy some land with her savings. She will put this loan towards the purchase of parts.

loans.use: to purchase motor starters for cars.

loans.name: Tawananyasha Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe.  25 year old Progress is from Machipisa, Harare.  She is married with three children and two attending school.  Progress runs a retail business selling clothes.  The business has been in operation for two years.  She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition.  Progress has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy clothes and shoes for resale.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of the family.  In the future, Progress plans to own a big shop selling a wide range of clothes and footwear.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old and married to Stephen. They have five children.

She has been in this business for the last eight years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 6,000.  She is applying for her second loan of Kes 20,000.  She paid the previous loan well and in good time.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Eunice hopes to use the funds to buy more vegetables and fruits for sale.  She would like open up a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Sènami Christine

texts.fr: Sènami Christine est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Anasthase. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sènami Christine  et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sènami Christine  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sènami Christine  mène comme activité depuis onze ans environs, la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (bols en séries, glacières, plats, etc.) de façon ambulante et aussi par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Sènami Christine  vend des friperies et des sacs de sortie. Sènami Christine  s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire, Sènami Christine  sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Senami Christine is 36 years old and is married to one Anastasius. The couple has two children both in school and who are their dependents. Senami Christine and her husband handle jointly the various family expenses.

Senami Christine has not attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her family over the past eleven years, she has been running a businees selling kitchenware (bowl sets, coolers, dishes, etc.), as an itinerant vendor and also through the distribution system. She also sells second-hand clothing and handbags as a second source of income, and resupplies in Benin and Togo.

In order to raise the level of her business activities and increase her customer base and turnover, Senami Christine is requesting for the sixth time a credit loan from ALIDé. All previously received funds have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy kitchenware (bowl sets, dishes, coolers, etc.)

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo es de la ciudad de Carapeguá tiene 48 años, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia con su esposa Severina. Es macatero (vendedor ambulante), aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien empezó a incursionar en el ámbito de ventas desde muy pequeño.
Decidió dedicarse al rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia y a esta le acompaña la necesidad de dar ingreso a su familia. El se define como un hombre trabajador, honesto,  responsable y emprendedor, que se esfuerza al máximo diariamente para poder darle a su familia lo mejor para que no tengan que pasar por privaciones.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de colchas, sobrecamas, sabanas, fundas,etc. los cuales son los principales productos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Alejo is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is 48 years old, married and has two children.  He lives in his own home with his wife Severina.  He is a macatero (street vendor).  He learned this trade from his father with whom he started dabbling in sales when he was very young.  He decided to dedicate himself to this trade since he has experience and he needed to provide his family with an income.  

He describes himself as a hard-working, honest, responsible and enterprising man who works hard every day to be able to give his family the best so that they do not have to experience hardship.  He needs the loan to purchase quilts, bedspreads, sheets and pillowcases as these are the main products he sells.  

He is grateful to Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: purchase quilts, bedspreads, sheets and pillowcases to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Gisèle et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Gisèle mène comme activité depuis vingt et un ans environs, la vente de farine de manioc et divers produits (tomate, oignons, piments, gombo, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Gisèle vend de l’huile de palme et de l’huile d’arachide. Gisèle s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire, Gisèle sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gisele is 46 years old  and is married to one Joseph. The couple has three children, all attending school and who are their dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple has another child under their care. Gisele and her husband handle together the various family expenditures.

Gisele has not attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her family over the past twenty-one years, Gisèle's business activity has been the sales of cassava flour and other products (tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra, etc.) from her home.

As a second source of income, she also sells palm oil and peanut oil. Gisele gets her supplies from Benin.

Wanting to raise the level of her business activities and increase her customer base and turnover, Gisele is requesting for the fourth time a credit loan from ALIDé. All previously received funds were reimbursed in full.

loans.use: Buy food products (tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra, etc.), and cassava flour.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 42 años, se dedica a la venta de desayuno en dos puntos de ventas junto con su esposo, tiene 3 hijos, es casada,
Dionicia siempre valoró todo lo que hicieron por ella, las capacitaciones, la ayuda con los préstamos, le ayudan a poder ser mejor persona y mejor comerciante, antes solo tenia un puesto de venta ahora con el esfuerzo que puso tiene otro punto de venta, se siente tranquila por las cosas que esta logrando y todo es gracias al apoyo que le brinda Finca, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos  para los desayunos.
texts.en: Dionicia is 42 years old, married and has 2 children.  For a living, she sells breakfast with her husband at two different places.  Dionicia is a member of the communal bank Llapanchik. She always values everything they do for her such as the training workshops, the financial help, and they help her to be a better person and merchant.  Before she only had one sales stand, but now, with a lot of hard work, she has set up another sales stand. The things she is achieving give her peace of mind and all of this is thanks to Finca's support.  With her loan she will purchase supplies for her breakfasts.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her breakfasts.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: La señora Maria Leticia a sus 55 años es una gran hija quien se encuentra a cargo de su padre quien tiene más de 70 años, de un cultivo de papa, cría de vacas y dos sobrinos a quienes su madre murió hace 7 años de cáncer. Con el ánimo de salir adelante y sobrepasar las dificultades que el invierno a causado en su cultivo y en la economía de la familia, la señora Maria Leticia necesita de la compra de abonos y riegos con los cuales puede mejorar su cultivo y así poder sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su padre y dos sobrinos.
texts.en: Señora Maria Leticia, at her 55 years of age, is a wonderful daughter who takes care of her father, who is over 70, a potato crop, their cattle and two nephews whose mother died of cancer 7 years ago.  With a spirit that inspires her to get ahead and move past the difficulties the winter caused to her crops and her family's finances, Señora Maria Leticia plans to purchase fertilizer and irrigation supplies.  With the purchase, she will be able to improve her crop and thereby meet the household expenses and improve her father's and nephews' quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural items like fertilizers and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
12 señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de Comités de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información. De alli surge el comité denominado San Pedro. Estas señoras son activas, buscan un poco mas de apoyo para aumentar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
La señora Palmira es una de las miembros, ella agradece la oportunidad a la Fundación Paraguaya por que este crédito le será de gran ayuda para poder seguir creciendo. Palmira nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que cocina muy rico y por ello ha podido formarse ya una buena clientela. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para los alimentos que hace.
texts.en:
Twelve women with very few resources joined the Paraguayan Foundation's Committee of Enterprising Women Program and decided to meet to get information about it. From there came the committee called San Pedro. These women are active and looking for a little more help to increase their household income and improve their quality of life. 

Palmira is one of the members. She is grateful for the opportunity from the Paraguayan Foundation, because this loan will be a big help that will allow her to keep growing. Palmira tells us that she makes a living selling all kinds of food, which is going very well, since she cooks very well. Because of this she has already been able to establish a good customer base. One of her goals is to be able to keep growing and helping her family. 

She is asking for the loan for the purchase of meat, vegetables, condiments, baking goods, and all the other necessary ingredients for the foods she makes.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, baking goods, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta, tiene 45 años, ella es dueña de una Ferretería, es madre de 5 niños, es casada, es socia de Finca desde hace 2 años, 
Margarita empezó en la calle como ambulante vendiendo pollo, tuvo un fracaso y no sabia que hacer, y una amiga le invitó a Finca y desde la fecha las cosas han mejorado mucho, gracias a las capacitaciones y al apoyo financiero, valora mucho la confianza que dan a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, ahora su negocio ha crecido, con el préstamo comprará materiales para construcción.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Violeta Communal Bank. She is 45 and the owner of a hardware store. She is the mother of five children, married, and has been a member of Finca for two years. 

Margarita began as a traveling street vendor, selling chicken. A disaster happened to her and she didn't know what to do, so a friend invited her to Finca. To date, things are very much improved, thanks to their training and financial support. She really values the trust that they give to women of very few economic resources. Now her business has grown, and with this loan she will buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Moynatou

texts.fr: Moynatou est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Kabirou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Moynatou  et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Moynatou mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs, la vente d'alcool médical dans une ville du Bénin. Moynatou  s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigéria. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire, Moynatou  sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit  auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Moynatou is 46 years old and is married to one Kabirou. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school but all are their dependents. In addition to their own children, they have two other children under their care. Moynatou and her husband handle together the various family expenditures.

To provide for her needs and those of her family over the past ten years, Moynatou has been selling medicinal alcohol in one of Benin's cities. She resupplies in Benin and Nigeria.

To raise the level of her business activity and increase her customer base and turnover, Moynatou is requesting for the sixth time a credit loan from ALIDé. Funds received previously were fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy medicinal alcohol wholesale.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta, tiene 42 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, tiene 4 hijos, esta en Finca hace 10 años.
Adela agradece todo el progreso que tiene, ya que con los préstamos y capacitaciones le ayudan a poder tener una educación financiera, ha mejorado su vida económica, y familiar, es una entidad que ayuda a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y zapatos.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the communal bank "Violeta."  She is 42 years old, has 4 children,  and has a business selling clothing and shoes.  She has been with FINCA for 10 years.  Adela appreciates all of the progress that she's made with the loans, and the training that has helped her to become educated on financial matters.  This has improved her finances and her family life.  FINCA is an organization that helps low-income women.  With this loan, Adela will invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling.  His father is the one supporting the family and they all depend on him.  Despite his young age, Fouad took responsibility on his own and decided to start his own business.  He opened his own metal shop where he repairs mechanical generators.  Today he’s requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase metal supplies and tools for his work.  He notes that this will facilitate his business operations and help him work in a proper way.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies and tools for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 61 years old and married with six children.

Allen works hard to provide for her family.  She runs an ambulant store of grocery items in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Allen has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the ambulant store of grocery items for 15 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Allen aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Félicienne  est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Joachim. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Félicienne et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Félicienne  mène comme activité depuis neuf ans environs, la vente de produits divers (igname, oignons, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Félicienne vend de l’huile à moteur. Félicienne s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Félicienne sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Félicienne ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Félicienne is 40 years old and married to a man named Joachim. The couple has four dependent children, some of whom go to school. In addition to their own children, they also have two other children in their care. 

Félicienne and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. In order to support herself and provide for her family, she has been selling various products (yams, onions, cassava flour, etc.) from her home for approximately nine years. As a secondary activity, she also sells motor oil. 
She buys her stock in Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her sales and revenue, Félicienne is seeking a sixth loan from ALIDé. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy yams, onions and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Gladiz Maruja

texts.es:
Gladiz es socia del Banco Comunal Pampachacra, es madre de un hijo, es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 14 años.
Gladiz se dedica a la venta de tara, cochinilla y abarrotes en Panpachacra, agradece mucho la ayuda que le brindan con semilla ayudan que las mujeres puedan salir adelante, invirtiéndolo bien en sus negocios, en su Banco Comunal aprendió como trabajar, logró comprarse un terreno en Mollepata, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder valorarse, todo lo que se hace en Finca le ayudo a poder tener una buena familia, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Gladiz, the mother of a son, is a member of Pampachacra Communal Bank.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for 14 years.  Gladiz works selling tara [a tree native to Peru], cochineal, and groceries in Pampachacra.

She is very grateful for the help they offer with seed money.  They help so women are able to get ahead, investing well in their businesses.  In her communal bank she learned how to work.  She managed to buy herself a plot of land in Mollepata.  The instruction helps her to be able to assess herself.

Everything that is done in FINCA helped her to be able to have a good family.

With the loan she is getting now she will invest in buying groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Los Angeles 2 Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a una de las miembros, quien ya había formado parte de otro comité de la zona. La misma contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar su propio comité. Ellas agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya; ya que tendrán nuevas oportunidades  para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar.
La Sra. Zulma es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la costura,  lo que le permite tener un ingreso propio y así colaborar con los ingresos de su casa, es una persona responsable, y trabajadora. Ella nos comenta que siempre esta con mucho trabajo, lo cual la alegra mucho. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a las personas de su barrio también.
Zulma solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, lo cual la ayudará mucho, pues tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed thanks to one of the members, who had already been a member of another group in the area.  She reached out to her neighbors and friends in order to form her own communal bank.  They appreciate the opportunity that the Fundación  Paraguaya is providing them, since they will have new opportunities to start up better businesses, contribute income to their households, and in this way provide their children with a better life.

Zulma is one of the members.  She has a dressmaking business, which allows her to have her own income and in this way contribute to the income of her household.  She is a responsible and hardworking person.  She tells us that she always has a lot of work, and this makes her very happy.  One of her dreams is to be able to continue to grow her business, and in this way help out people in her neighborhood as well.

Zulma requests a loan to buy fabric and thread.  This will help her a lot, because she has a lot of orders and she would like to fill them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to use in her dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El Sr. Richard, es soltero y tiene 23 años de edad, el socio ahora se esta dedicando al trabajo como tecnico electricista,el arregla diferentes trabajos como conecciones electricas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda arreglar los trabajos de electricista. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como cables y herramientas para que haga los trabajos electricos.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Richard is single and is 23 years old.  He now works as an electrician, doing a variety of repairs such as working with electrical connections.  He works from 8am until 7pm, and through this work he wants to get ahead with his children.  Richard dreams of having a store where he could perform his electrical repairs.  He requests a loan to buy materials such as cords and tools that he needs to do his electrical work.

Richard values and appreciates the loan that is being granted, and he pledges to make his loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cords and tools that he needs to do his electrical work

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 32 years old.  She has three children between the ages of three and eight.  Two of them attend school.  She has spent eight years in the business of selling cooking oil, sugar, and salt.  With the loan she wants to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt to sell.  She expects to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.  In the future, she would like to have a store in the town where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is 42 years old and married to a farmer.  They have four children aged between 2 and 14.  All of her children go to school.  She has sold handbags for the last four years.  She needs the loan in order to buy more handbags.  With the profits, Daphrose will build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more handbags to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and has 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 53 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Anita has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Anita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 27 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children, three of whom go to school. She has spent 3 years selling different items in her store. With the loan, she will add more items to her store, such as rice, soaps, sugar and cooking oil to sell. She wants to use the profits to make savings. She would like to own a large shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, soaps and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sofiatou

texts.fr: Sofiatou est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Théodore. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Sofiatou et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sofiatou  n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément depuis une dizaine d’année et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité et pour mieux assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Sofiatou  vend dans son atelier, des tissus et des produits cosmétiques. Sofiatou  s’approvisionne au Nigéria et au Togo. Ce premier crédit permettra certainement à Sofiatou  de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Sofiatou is 34 years old and she is married to a man named Théodore. The couple have three dependent children who all attend school. In addition to their own, they also have two other children in their care. Sofiatou and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Sofiatou did not go to school, but she did learn the trade of hairstyling, an activity she has been practicing passionately for about ten years, and which allows her to earn significant income. To better provide for her children, Sofiatou also sells fabrics and cosmetics from her shop as a secondary activity. 

Sofiatou gets her stock in Nigeria and Togo. This first loan will help her to bolster her activity and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetics, and fabrics.

loans.name: Alejandrina  Perez

texts.es:
Alejandrina es dueña de una Fabrica de Yesos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 8 años.
Alejandrina aprendió en Finca que siempre se tiene que ahorrar y seguir adelante a pesar de las adversidades, le encanta las capacitaciones porque aprende mucho para poder guiar bien su negocio y su familia, ahora el préstamo que esta sacando lo invertirá en la compra de piedra de yeso y leña.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is the owner of a plaster factory. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years.

Alejandrina learned from FINCA that she must always save and continue to move forward despite facing adversity. She enjoys the training classes because she has learned a great deal on how to manage her business and her family well. The loan she is receiving now will be invested in the purchase of stone and firewood for making plaster.

loans.use: to buy stone and firewood for making plaster.

loans.name: Xavera

texts.en: Xavera, aged 45, is a widow with 1 child who is 23 years old. Xavera has been selling foodstuffs for the past 4 years. She has requested the loan to add more different kinds of food items such as beans, bananas and sorghum. From the profits she expects to continue to make savings. In the future, she dreams to have a large store of food items.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling used clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her buying and selling of used clothing business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 22 years. Cecilia earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Yerevan with her pensioner mother and two little babies. She earns her living by selling flowers and gifts from her little shop. Anna has been running the business for a year already. Now she would like to expand her business and increase the variety of goods. With the requested loan, Anna plans to purchase toys to sell. This loan will help Anna to increase sales and make her business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for toys

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 21 years old. She is married to a bicycle mechanic. Odette sells spare parts for bicycles. She has been running this business for 7 years. She wants the loan to buy more spare parts to sell. With the profits, she will buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald works hard to support his family.  He is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Donald requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle maintenance.

Donald has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 54 years old.  She has two children aged between 14 and 16 years and they go to school.  She has been selling clothes for 11 years.  She is willing to request this loan in order to buy more clothes.  With the profits she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and has four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is 32 years old.  She has three children and two of them go to school.  Patricie sells different merchandise in her store for which she has been running for the past 10 years.  She needs this loan to buy more items such as rice, soap, and sugar.  She will use the profits to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soap, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en: Theopiste aged 27 years old has three children.  One of her kids goes to school.  She has been running the business of selling kid's clothes for eight years. She has requested this loan to buy more clothes to sell.  She plans to use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more kids cloths to sell.

loans.name: Ignacienne

texts.en: Ignacienne is 47 years old. She is a widow selling skirts. She has spent seven years in the business. She has requested the loan to buy more skirts to sell. With the profits she earns, she will build a house for her business. She would like to own a large clothing store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, age 42, is married to a businessman. They have three children between the ages of 12 and 17. All of her children go to school. She sells different items in a boutique, which she has spent seven years running. With the requested loan, she will buy more soap, sugar, and rice to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, and rice to sell

loans.name: Simone

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Simone est mariée à William un soudeur. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, Simone a deux autres enfants à charge. Simone vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Simone n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Simone prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce) qu’elle vend de façon ambulante. Simone exerce cette activité depuis treize ans. Simone s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élever le niveau de son activité, Simone sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Simone is 37 years old and is married to William, a welder. The couple has two children, both dependants and both attending school. In addition to their own children, Simone supports two other children as well. Simone lives with her husband and her children. Simone did not attend school. The couple covers the various family expenses together.

In order to provide for herself and for her children, Simone prepares food (corn dough accompanied by a sauce) which she sells from place to place. Simone has been doing this for 13 years. She gets her supplies from Benin.

Striving to satisfy her customers and improve her business, Simone is asking for a fourth loan through ALDIé. Her first three loans were all paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy corn, sauces, preserves, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is 25 years old and married with one child. She and her husband work together in a business selling cattle and goats, which they have been running for the period of one year. She has requested the loan to buy more cattle and goats to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to renovate the house. She would like to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase footwear

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
El Sr. Derlis tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguazú. El comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos electrónicos, lentes de sol y demás productos.
Derlis se dedica a este trabajo hace mas de 5 años, empezó con un pequeño ahorro que tenia, con ese tiempo y gracias a los créditos concedidos por nuestra entidad y de esa manera fue ampliando su stock de productos y pudo crecer y salir adelante. Derlis desea ir ampliando su negocio ya que el sustenta de su familia y por lo tanto desea brindarles una vida digna a sus padres, ya que están viejos y desea que tengan una vejez digna.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos electrónicos como ser radios pequeños, walkman y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr. Derlis is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú. He says that he sells electronic goods, sunglasses, and other products as a traveling salesman.

Derlis has been in this type of work for more than five years. He started out using a small amount of savings that he accumulated. Over the course of time and with the loans from Fundación Paraguaya, Derlis was able to expand his inventory of products so that he could grow and move forward. He wants to increase his business so that he can sustain his family and provide a decent life for his parents. They are elderly and would like to have a decent retirement.

Derlis is requesting a loan to buy electronic goods such as miniature radios, Walkmans, and other products so that he can restock his inventory. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for giving him this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy miniature radios, Walkmans, and other electronic goods.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Feliciano, es soltero y tiene 30 años de edad, el socio sigue trbajando en una empresa publica y tambien ahora tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,galletas y aceite,el trabaja junto con su esposa y asi juntos salen adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Feliciano is 30 years old and single. He continues to work at a public institution and now he also has a grocery store where he sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, cookies, and oil. Feliciano works with his partner and they are able to move forward together. His dream is to expand his grocery store. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products for cooking such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil in bulk.

Feliciano values and appreciates the loan that has been provided. He promises to complete the payment of his debts in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Paul Agusto

texts.es:
Paul tiene 27 años edad y es soltero, él nació en la ciudad de Gamitana y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él se dedica a la venta de agricultura donde cultiva diferentes productos como yuca, maíz, arroz y otras cosas, él también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Paul en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar el transporte de madera .

Paul es integrante del grupo “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” lo conforman 16 socios que viven en el Comunidad de Gamitana en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Paul is 27 years old and single. He was born in the city of Gamitana and still lives there. Paul sells different farm-raised products such as cassava, corn, rice, and other products. He also buys and sells wood. Paul has been in this business for many years and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for the transport of wood.

Paul is a member of the group “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” (New Dawn of Gamitana) which consists of 16 members who live in the community of Gamitana in the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of wood.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Saoudatou

texts.fr: Saoudatou  est âgée de 32 ans et n’est pas encore mariée. Saoudatou  n’a pas d’enfant. Saoudatou  vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Saoudatou  mène comme activité la vente de chaussures et de produits divers (riz, pâtes alimentaires, vinaigre, conserves, etc.) à son domicile. Saoudatou achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. Saoudatou  exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Ce deuxième crédit permettra certainement à Saoudatou  de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Saoudatou is 32 years old and is not yet married. She has no children. She lives by herself and covers her various expenses on her own.

In order to provide for herself, Saoudatou sells shoes and a variety of other products (rice, pasta, vinager, canned food, etc.) from her home. Saoudatou buys the products in Benin and Togo. She has been doing this for seven years now.

Saoudatou's second loan will allow her to improve her business and better respond to the demands her customers.

loans.use: to buy various products (rice, pasta, vinager, canned food, etc.)

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old and married with 3 children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling fermented shrimp in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Fe has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her shrimp business for 14 years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fermented shrimp

loans.name: Florence Nyachama

texts.en: Florence, 46, is married to a businessman and has four children, ranging from 14 to 30 years. Previously, she was employed at a wholesale shop. For the last 7 years, Florence has been running a retail shop. She is facing a challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy flour, bread, sugar, etc.. Florence hopes and dreams to diversify her business within the next 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase flour, bread, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gurgonia

texts.en:
Gurgonia is 64 years old and married with 8 children.

Gurgonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Gurgonia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Gurgonia aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  socia Maritza; tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia tiene 1 hija; La socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia ampliar el local de restaurant . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas al por mayor.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 37 years old, single, and has a daughter. She now manages her restaurant business where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Maritza works from 8am to 7pm. Through this business, she is able to help her child move forward. Maritza dreams of expanding the site of her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and crackers in bulk.

Maritza is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, and crackers in bulk.

loans.name: Hiede

texts.en:
Hiede is 56 years old. She is widowed and has three children.

Hiede works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Hiede has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and through the retail sales of feed.

Hiede aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Maria Silenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Silenia a sus 38 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos de 18, 14, 7 y un años y medio de edad, con el ánimo de salir adelante con su familia, desde hace 4 años inicio su propio negocio de venta de mercancía tal como ropa interior, jeans, camisetas, cosméticos y cobijas en donde sus clientes son los habitantes del municipio de la Ceja ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. La señora Maria Silenia ha tenido dificultades debido a que varios de sus clientes se han quedado sin empleo por lo que no le han pagado sus cuentas, lo que se refleja en pérdidas para la señora Silenia. Con el ánimo de recuperarse la señora Silenia tiene la esperanza de que comprando más surtido puede tener nuevos clientes y así mejores ingresos y poder entonces aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Silenia is 38 years old and the mother of four children (ages 18, 14, 7, and 1½). She is excited about moving forward along with her family. Four years ago, she started her own business selling merchandise such as undergarments, jeans, t-shirts, cosmetics, and blankets to her customers who reside in the town of La Ceja, which is located east of Antioquia. Sra. Maria Silenia has had difficulties because several of her customers have been without work, thus preventing them from paying their bills. This has resulted in losses.

Motivated to recover, Sra. Silenia has hope and wants to buy more inventory so that she can acquire new customers in order to generate more income. As a result, she will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 47 years old. She is married with one child who is currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Judy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Judy has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, coffee, milk, etc. 

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Bianca

texts.es:
Bianca integrante del Banco comunal “Futuros Emprendedores” perteneciente a la comuna de Peñalolén. 
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo productos de artesanía, entre los cuales se encuentran ropa hindú para dama, varón y niños, además accesorios como; aros, collares, pulseras, pañoletas, entre otros. Todo esto lo ofrece en un puesto que instala en una feria libre y feria persa. Su horario de trabajo es de martes a domingo.
Comenta que su negocio es familiar y está funcionando desde hace 7 años. En éste negocio también trabaja su madre y su hermano. 
La mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, primordialmente donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, principalmente productos innovadores.  
Sus metas son seguir prosperando en su negocio y que éste se pueda mantener en el tiempo. 
Bianca vive junto a su madre, su hermano y su hija de 6 años de edad. Bianca comenta que estudia en la Universidad la carrera de derecho, por lo que uno de sus sueños es terminar sus estudios, además le gustaría obtener su vivienda propia y brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que le permite brindar un sustento económico para su familia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta que la ayuda recibida no es solo monetaria, sino también educativa, ya que con las capacitaciones ha aprendido de contabilidad de una forma más técnica.
Por otro lado el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido, responsable y comprometido.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Bianca is a member of the Communal Bank “Futuros Emprendedores” (Future Entrepreneurs) which is located in the town of Peñalolén. She works in the retail trade, specifically selling handcrafted products, which include clothing from India for women, men, and children, and accessories such as rings, necklaces, bracelets, scarves, and other items. She offers all of her merchandise from a vending stall at both the open market and at the Persian fair. Her work schedule is from Tuesday to Sunday.

Bianca says that her venture is a family business that has been in operation for seven years. She works with her mother and brother. Bianca purchases her merchandise from different distributors, especially those that offer the most affordable prices. With this loan she will buy merchandise for her business, mostly innovative products.

Bianca lives with her mother, her brother, and her six-year-old daughter. She says that she is studying at the university for a law degree, so one of her dreams is to finish her studies. In addition, she would like to buy a house of her own and provide her daughter a better quality of life. Bianca is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza so that she can invest in her business. In addition, she says that the assistance she receives not only consists of financing, but it also includes education. As part of her training classes, Bianca has learned more advanced methods of accounting. By working alongside her Communal Bank group, she feels united, responsible, and committed.

Peñalolén is located east of the Metropolitana region. It has several attractions such as vineyards, historical buildings, and natural archaeological sites. These elements have transformed this area into a tourist haven in the Metropolitana region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Guy. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Odile n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs sept ans, Odile mène comme activité la vente de fruits (pommes fruits, raisins, bananes, etc.) de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales. Odile achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Odile sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Odile is 28 years old and is married to a welder named Guy. The couple has two children, both dependants and both attending school. Odile and her husband cover the various family expenses together. Odile did not attend school.

For seven years now, Odile has been selling fruit (apples, grapes, bananas, etc.) from place to place. This allows her to provide for herself and support her family. Odile buys her products in Benin.

With the intention of increasing the amount of products that she sells and better meeting the demand of her customers, Odile is asking for a fifth loan through ALIDé. All of her previous loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fruit

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

Lolita has a food-vending business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Lolita is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: María Encarnación

texts.es: María Encarnación de cuarenta años de edad vive con sus hijos. Ella posee una pupuseria y una venta de tortas cerca del lugar donde reside, vende pupusas de frijol, queso, chicharrón y tortas de jamón, carne, pollo entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues sus comidas son las más exquisitas con un sabor inigualable, todo hecho con material de excelente calidad y con un servicio muy rápido además de los precios accesibles, María muchas veces se lleva a su hija menor porque no puede pagar quien la cuide; Ella es una mujer entregada a su trabajo pone todo su esfuerzo para poder satisfacer a todos sus clientes y estar adelante de la competencia, tiene muchas metas que quiere alcanzar  y una de ellas es poder  ver crecer su negocio, piensa que el más grande secreto para alcanzar ese éxito es la perseverancia, es por eso que le se ha decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, queso, chicharrón, frijoles, maíz, pan etc. María Encarnación tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Encarnación is 40 years old and lives with her children. She has a “pupusa” and sandwich business that is located near her home. María sells “pupusas” containing beans, cheese, and pork, as well as sandwiches made with ham, beef, chicken, and other ingredients. She has many customers because her food is exquisite and has unequalled flavor. All of her dishes are made with high-quality ingredients and she offers fast service at affordable prices. María must frequently take her young daughter with her because she cannot pay anyone to look after her. She is a devoted woman when it comes to her work and puts all of her effort into satisfying her customers and staying ahead of the competition.

María has many goals that she wants to achieve, one of them being to grow her business. She believes the greatest secret for being successful is perseverance. Maria has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy meats, cheese, pork, beans, corn, bread, and other supplies. She hopes that this support will provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meats, cheese, pork, beans, corn, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un vulcanisateur. Elle a 4 enfants.
Kossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle vend des produits génériques pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Akossiwa a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwa, age 31, is married to a tire maker and has four children. She's been a reseller of generic drugs since 2001.

She gets her supplies in Lomé, and resells at the market to any customer. She works alone, and does not face difficulties at this time.

Kossiwa is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase generic drugs. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to open a store. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy generic drugs

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 51 years old. She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Marciana is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Marciana has been buying and selling livestock for 30 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: To save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Marga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Marga;  La socia tiene 47 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 5 hijos; el ultimo de los hijos tiene 13 años de edad; la socia se dedica  la elaboración de tamales, panes, empanadas,  en los buses camino de Huaro a Urcos y viceversa, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos como son royal, manteca, azucar, maiz, y la socia compra todos los ingredientes en la ciudad de Cusco, luego viaja 1 hora hasta Urcos y prepara en casa todos los productos para la venta, La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes como son, royal, manteca, maiz, azucar, entre otros ingredientes.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Marga is a member of the Communal Bank “Qori Orcco” which is located in the District of Urcos in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 47 years old, single, and has five children. Her youngest child is 13 years old. Marga prepares tamales, bread, and empanadas and sells them on the buses that travel on the road from Huaro to Urcos and vice versa. She will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies such as baking powder, lard, sugar, and corn. Marga purchases all of her ingredients in the city of Cusco. She must then travel an hour to her home in Urcos where she prepares all of the products that she will sell. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these supplies.

Marga is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy baking powder, lard, sugar, and corn.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Rosaline est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Marcelin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosaline et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Rosaline mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente de poissons et de crevettes fumées dans un marché du Bénin. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un lac du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rosaline sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Rosaline ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Rosaline is 39 years old and married to a fisherman named Marcelin.  They have two children who both go to school and whom they financially support.  Rosaline and her husband take care of the various expenses of the family together.  In order to support herself and her family, Rosaline has been selling fish and smoked shrimps at a market in Benin for about eight years.  Rosaline gets her merchandise from a lake in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and income, Rosaline is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.  Her previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: To buy fish and fresh shrimps.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her business.

She earns more income from the buying and selling of spices. Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her business

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El socio es él Sr. Eleuterio; él socio continua trabajando con su familia y sus negocios de plastiqueria, el esta muy feliz porque a crecido mucho en el aspecto laboral y continua trabajando duro para poder a futuro cercano poner sus tiendas tipo sucursales a nivel de toda la región, el socio a integrado a sus hijos en el negocio familiar y el mismo esta estudiando cursos de administracion de empresas para mejorar especialmenmte en el area de marketing; el socio es una persona miuy alegre y optimista el tiene muchos sueños y los esta cumpliendo con mucho esfuerszo y trabajo. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra inicial de su mercaderia de plasticos que le llega de Juliaca y Lima.
texts.en:
This is Sr. Eleuterio.  He continues to work with his family and his plastics business. He is happy because his business has grown a lot and he continues to work hard to be able to open small stores around the region in the not too distant future. His children work in the family business and he is also studying administration courses to improve his business, especially in the area of marketing. He is a very happy person who has many dreams and with a lot of hard work and determination he is accomplishing those dreams. 

Eleuterio is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of plastics that will reach Juliaca and Lima.

loans.use: to purchase plastics for his business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, neither of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family. Pamela has a business of selling secondhand clothes.  She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 1 day out of every week.  She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Pamela has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes for the Christmas season.    

The main business challenges for Pamela include the increasing prices of clothes and the transportation of clothes from Kampala city to her stall.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also start importing used clothes. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines of buying and selling dressed chickens. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dressed chickens to sell. In the future, Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of dressed chickens to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nohemy

texts.es: La señora Maria Nohemy a sus 40 años de edad desea iniciar su propio negocio de cría y venta de pollos para vender a sus vecinos y tiendas cercanas a su vivienda localizada en una vereda del municipio del Carmen de Viboral ubicado al norte de Antioquia. Este negocio que la señora Maria Nohemy adecuará en su finca tiene como fin tratar de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo quien tiene dificultades de salud. La señora Maria Nohemy espera poder construir el lugar donde vivan sus pollos y comprar 100 de estos para poder comenzar con su negocio. El sueño de la señora Maria Nohemy es ver crecer su negocio y la mejoría de su esposo.
texts.en: Señora Maria Nohemy, age 40, wants to start her own business raising and selling chickens to her neighbours as well as nearby stores. She lives in a district of the El Carmen de Viboral municipality, located in the north of Antioquia. Maria Nohemy will start this new business on her farm. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and that of her husband, who has health problems. Maria Nohemy hopes to be able to buy 100 chickens and build a chicken coop in order to start this business. Her dream is to see her business grow and her husband's health improve.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens and build a chicken coop

loans.name: Jesús Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: Carmen es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” grupo conformado por 10 socios responsables y trabajadores. Carmen tiene 41 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando al menor de ellos ya que se encuentra en etapa escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, también  a la compra y venta de productos como turrones, alfajores, queques entre otros, gracias a  su trabajo a mejorado la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia, también nos cuenta que hace 06 meses inicio un nuevo negocio la cual instalo en su domicilio una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, es de esta manera como Carmen a apoyado con los gastos del hogar. A futuro a Carmen le gustaría terminar de construir el tercer piso de su vivienda ya que tiene previsto alquilarlo. En esta oportunidad solicito el préstamo para la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz, y juguetes  para venderlos por fiestas navideñas. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús Pan de Vida” están muy agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa-Prosperidad. Melina y Janet no pudieron estar presente en el desembolso por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the "Jesús Pan de Vida" communal bank, which is made up of ten responsible and hard-working members. Carmen is 41, married, and has two children. Currently she continues to support the youngest of these, as the child is of school-age. 

She sells beauty products, and also buys and sells products such as nougats, cookies, cakes, and other items. Thanks to her work she has improved the quality of life for her and her family. 

She also says that six months ago, she started a new business that she set up in her home. It is a small general store, where she sells basic household necessities. This is the way Carmen has helped with the household expenses. 

In the future, Carmen would like to finish building the third floor of her house, as she has plans to rent it. On this occasion, she applied for he loan in order to buy milk, sugar, rice, and toys to sell during the Christmas holidays. 

The members of the "Jesús Pan de Vida" communal bank are grateful, and promise to continue working well with Programa Prosperidad. 

Melina and Janet could not be present at the disbursement meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, rice, and toys.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is 34 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 14.  In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Sumitra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Pélagie est mariée à Félicien un commerçant. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Pélagie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pélagie vend depuis huit ans, des produits cosmétiques et plusieurs autres produits nécessaires pour le trousseau d’un bébé. Pélagie s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élever le niveau de son activité, Pélagie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pélagie is 32 years old and married to Félicien, a trader. The couple have 2 children, one of whom attends school. They are also raising 2 children who are not their own. Pélagie lives together with her husband and the children, and the couple both contribute to the household expenses.

Pélagie did not go to school. In order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her children, she has been selling beauty products and articles needed for a baby´s trousseau for the past 8 years. She gets her supplies in Nigeria.

Pélagie is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé so that she can restock on products that will enable her to satisfy customer demand and increase her business. She has fully repaid her 2 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Karina;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad; La socia tiene su propio negocio de restaurante, la socia brinda este servicio a los pobladores y turistas que visitan la zona, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de cubiertos para mejorar su servicio y también desea comprar platos tendidos y hondos para las sopas, comprara también pirex para los postres y salseros para la sal, otros para el limon, ají y algunos adornos para implementar el restaurante. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de cubiertos, platos y otros accesorios para implementar el restaurante.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Karina belongs to the "Qori Orcco" communal bank, located in the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

She is 27, single, and has a seven year-old child. She has her own restaurant business. She serves locals, and tourists who visit the area. 

On this occasion, she wishes to use the loan to buy cutlery in order to improve her service. She also wishes to buy dinner plates, and soup bowls. She will also buy Pyrex dishes for desserts, serving containers for salt, and others for lemon and chili pepper, as well as a few decorations for the restaurant. 

She wishes to use the loan to buy cutlery, dishes and other accessories for running the restaurant. She is thankful for the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy cutlery, dishes, and other accessories for running her restaurant.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Thelma works hard to support her family. She has a peanut candy making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of livestock and from pig fattening.
