Thelma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her peanut candy making business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: La señora Sandra Patricia se dedica a la venta y reparación de teléfonos celulares en un pequeño local que adecuo en la sala de su casa y el cual le brinda los recursos económicos mínimos para el sostenimiento propio y el de sus tres hijos, puesto que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos. Con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ventas y con estas el bienestar de sus hijos, la señora Sandra Patricia necesita de la compra de teléfonos celulares y herramientas de trabajo para su reparación que a su vez le permitan prestar un mejor servicio. El sueño de la señora Sandra Patricia es ver crecer a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia sells and repairs cell phones, in a small shop she has set up in her home. This business provides minimal financial resources for her own support and that of her three children, as she doesn't have support from her children's father. 

With the hope of improving her sales and thereby the well-being of her children, Sandra Patricia needs to buy cell phones and work tools for repairing them. In turn, this allows her to provide a better service. 

Sandra Patricia's dream is to see her children grow up, and to provide them with a good education.

loans.use: To buy cell phones, and work tools for repairing them.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Susan has a grocery store business. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Susan sells her products in a retail shop. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt.
 
The main business challenges for Susan include the increasing prices of commodities and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. Susan lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 41 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 20, 19 and 18.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda works hard to support her family. Linda is married and has an entertainment (Resto Bar) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of liquor and canned juices to sell. In the future, Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of liquor and canned juices to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Norma;  La socia tiene 35 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 4 hijos de 16, 15, 9, 6 años de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende animales menores como cuyes, pollos, , gallinas, la socia lleva a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado en cjas; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de un total de 80 al mes de gallinas, la socia compra por semanas ella compra 40 a 60 gallinas a la semana;  y comprara 160 cuyes. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the ”Qori Orcco" communal bank, located in the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department. She is 35, and lives with her partner. She has 4 children, ages 16, 15, 9, and 6. 

She has a retail business, where she buys and sells small animals such as guinea pigs, roosters, and hens. She takes them to the city of Puerto Maldonado in crates to sell. 

On this occasion, she wishes to use the loan to buy a total of 80 hens a month. She buys weekly. She buys 40 to 60 hens a week. She will also buy 160 guinea pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and hens. 

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old, married, and has a four year old son. He has provided transportation services using his motorcycle for the past two years. His business faces the challenge of rising fuel prices. He will use this loan of KES 15,000 to buy spare parts for his motorbike and pawpaw seeds to start a new business of selling pawpaws. Peter hopes in the future to own more motorbikes so as to expand his motorbike transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike and to buy pawpaw seeds to venture into a new business of selling pawpaws.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Client de 49 ans, marie et père de 5 enfants dont tous sont scolarise,ayant deja bénéficie d'un prêt au premier cycle, il a fait des épargnes considérables ,il a rembourse sans difficultés  et avec ses benefices le prêt a beaucoup profite a améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en ajoutant des cartons de vivres frais comme de la viande, de cotes de porcs,cartons de poules a bouillir et de la charcuterie.
Pour l'avenir est entrain de se battre pour une ouvrir une grande boucherie, ajouter des nouveaux congélateurs et freezer et avec le temps le transformer en chambre froide pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
Vincent, age 49, is married and the father of 5 school-attending children. He obtained his first loan, which enabled him to put a considerable amount of money away.

He repaid his first loan without problems, and used his profits to significantly improve the living standard of his family.

With this new loan, he will bolster his stock by adding boxes of fresh products, such as meat, pork chops, boxes of boiling hens, and charcuteries.

He is currently fighting to open a large butcher shop and add new freezers, in order to turn it over time into a refrigerated storage room so that he can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase meat, fish, and chicken

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 24 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 4.  In 2004, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and wants to use this new loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: N’To

texts.fr:
Monsieur  N’TO  est âgé de 44 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DIENFING, un des villages de la sous - préfecture  de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
N’TO n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après avoir correctement rembourser les cinq prêts précédents, il est à son sixième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DIENFING et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
N’TO espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
N’To is 44 years old and lives with his five children and his spouse in a traditional family in Dienfing, one of the villages of the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, Koulikoro region.

N'To did not have the chance to go to school. Very early he became interested in income-generating businesses, notably buying, storage and selling of cereals. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was formerly a great businessman of cereals.

Due to the worry of satisfying his clearly growing clientèle, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso.

After having correctly repaid his five previous loans, he is on his sixth individual loan which will serve to buy 5 tons of cereals (corn, bean, mil [African cereal], fonio [African cereal]) from the farmers of Dienfing and surrounding areas which he will keep for at least three months. He sells essentially wholesale to a clientèle consisting of resellers from the large cities such as Bamako.

N'To hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 36 years old and married, with four children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice grains retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Cheryl has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice selling business for five years and also earns additional income from a sari sari (variety) store and from farming rice.

Cheryl aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur DRISSA  est âgé de 38 ans et vit avec ses 7 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DONGORONA, un des villages de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
DRISSA n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école car il fut  vite exclu du système éducatif.  Alors il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à l’embouche (qui est une des activités de leur famille) et à l’achat stockage vente de céréales qu’il appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de quatre ans, Monsieur DRISSA jouit d’une grande renommée et est très sollicité à Ouelessebougou et environs.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil) auprès des paysans producteurs qu’il gardera pendant au moins un mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Drissa is 38 years old and lives with his seven children and his spouse in a traditional family in Dongorona, one of the villages of the city of Ouelessebougou, Kati prefecture, Koulikoro region.

Drissa did not have the chance to succeed in school because he was quickly excluded from the educational system. So he became interested in income-generating businesses notably in cattle fattening (which is one of his family's businesses) and in buying, storage and selling of cereals which he learned from his uncle. With four years experience, Drissa enjoys great fame and is very much in demand in Ouelessebougou and surrounding areas.

Due to the worry of satisfying his clearly growing clientèle, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the first loan he is on his second individual loan which will serve to buy 4 tons of cereals (corn, bean, mil [African cereal]) from the farmers which he will keep for at least one month. He sells essentially wholesale to a clientèle consisting of resellers from the large cities such as Bamako.

Drissa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in his businesses.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawavi est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 1 enfant.
Yawavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des boissons pour tous clients dans son bar. Elle achète les produits à la brasserie de Lomé. Elle est aidée par une personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.
Yawavi a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons à la brasserie du bénin. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawavi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawavi, age 29, is married to a mason and has one child. Since 2008, she's been selling beverages to a diverse clientele in her bar.

She gets her supplies from a brewery in Lomé, and has one person to help her. At this time, her main difficulty is not being able to meet customer demand.

Yawavi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchases beverages from a Beninese brewery. She wants to reinvest in her business.  

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 51 years old and married, with ten children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Letecia has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her four younger children to college.

loans.use: To buy  fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is 28 years old.  She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 12.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Kabita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  ISSA  est un homme  qui est âgé de 48 ans et qui vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle dans le village de Dongorona, sous  préfecture de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, ISSA, qui n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école, s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage commercialement des céréales et des produits de cueillettes tels le néré, les noix d’acajou et  le tamarin.  
Nanti  de deux années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, ISSA  décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
ISSA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne  d’arachide et 5 sacs de grain de néré, auprès des paysans producteurs de DAFARA et de Ouelessebougou qu’il stockera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il effectue sa vente  au marché de Ouelesseboubou, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
ISSA   espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50000FCFA qui   sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt,  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Issa is a 48-year-old man living with his six children and his spouse in a traditional family in the village of Dongorona, Ouelessebougou subprefecture, Koulikoro region.

In order to fit into economic life, Issa, who did not have the chance to succeed in school, quickly learned the business of commercially storing cereals and products of picking such as néré [seeds from the African Néré tree], cashew nuts and tamarind.

Well-off with two years experience in this field, he is very much in demand.

In his search for complementary financial resources, Issa decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan.

Issa plans to use his loan to buy 1 ton of corn, 1 ton of ground nuts and 5 bags of néré seeds from the farmers of Dafara and Ouelessebougou which he will store for at least 2 months.

He sells at the market of Ouelessebougou, for cash and rarely for credit to a clientèle which consists of women and men.

Issa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, meet the needs of the family's expenses and reinvest the rest in the businesses.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of corn, 1 ton of ground nuts and 5 bags of néré seeds [from the African Néré tree].

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 38 years old and married with five children. She earns a living from a rice grains retail business in the Philippines. Sherly is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Sherly has been for in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene integrante del Banco comunal “Futuros Emprendedores”, perteneciente a la comuna de Peñalolén.
Se dedica al  corte y confección de ropa, desempeñándose como costurera.
Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 10 años.
Habilitó un pequeño taller al interior de su casa, en el cual cuenta con 5 máquinas de coser, entre industriales, recta y bordadora. Esta diversidad de maquinarias le ha permitido entregar sus servicios a diferentes colegios y clientes particulares. 
Además comenta que durante esta temporada de navidad se instala en una feria navideña en la cual vende toallas y otros artículos navideños.
Comenta que su mercadería la compra en la comuna de Independencia, ya que es en éste sector donde los precios de telas y demás insumos los encuentra a un bajo costo. 
Su horario de trabajo lo flexibiliza, sin embargo debe tener disponibilidad para trabajar todos los días, de lunes a domingo.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para sus costuras, entre telas, hilos y cierres, ya que debe organizarse con la ropa de colegio para la temporada escolar, la cual es durante el mes de marzo.
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio y comprar una máquina colleretera, la cual sirve para realizar las terminaciones de puños y cuellos de poleras y polerones. 
Irene vive junto a su marido y comenta que uno de sus sueños es salir a vacacionar al sur del país, ya que quiere descansar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, para invertir en su negocio, por lo que significa mucho para Irene, además las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido mucho, ya que ha aprendido a invertir y obtener mejores ganancias. 
Por otro lado se encuentra muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que realizan actividades, es un grupo solidario y responsable.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the “Futuros Emprendedores” communal bank, located in the municipality of Peñalolén. She cuts and sews clothing, and works as a seamstress. She has been working in this sector for ten years. 

She equipped a small workshop inside her home, where she has five sewing machines, including industrial, straight stitch, and embroidering machines. This variety of machines has enabled her to provide her services to various schools and private customers.

The also mentions that during this Christmas season, she has a stand in a Christmas market where she sells towels, and other Christmas items. She says that she buys her merchandise in the Independencia municipality, as in this area where she finds fabric and other supplies at lower prices.  

She keeps her hours of work flexible, however she must be available to work every day from Monday to Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy sewing supplies, including fabric, thread, and zippers, as she must get herself organized for making school clothing for the back-to-school season, which is during the month of March. 

Her goals are to expand her business, and to purchase a cover stitch machine, used for finishing cuffs and necks of T-shirts, and sweatshirts.

Irene lives with her husband, and says that one of her dreams is to go on vacation in the south of the country, as she wants to take a break. 

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business, which means a lot to Irene. In addition, the training provided at the meetings has been very useful, as she has learned to invest, and improve her earnings. As well, she feels very comfortable with the communal bank she belongs to, as they do activities together, and it is a supportive and responsible group. 

Peñalolén is located to the east of the Santiago Metropolitan Region, It has various attractions, such as vineyards, heritage buildings, and natural areas for excursions. These are the elements that are transforming this municipality into a new tourist destination within the Metropolitan Region.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, and zippers.

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPERANCE est formé de quatre personnes qui appartiennent tous au même groupe d'artisans. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Honorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Honorine ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec elle. Honorine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris la décoration. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les différentes charges de son enfant, Honorine exerce cette activité de décoration depuis une douzaine d'année. De façon secondaire, Honorine vend des sacs de riz et des boissons devant son atelier. Honorine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle, Honorine et les autres membres du groupe ESPERANCE sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group Esperance is made up of 4 members who all belong to the same team of craftspeople.

Honorine, whose hand is raised in the picture, is the group's representative. Honorine no longer lives with her husband and is raising a child who attends school. She herself left school during her secondary education and learnt how to be a decorator.

In order to be able to meet her needs and cover the various expenses for her child, Honorine has been a practising decorator for about 12 years. She also has a sideline business selling bags of rice and drinks in front of her studio. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Honorine and the members of the Esperance group are seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to better satisfy customer demand and increase their business. The loan will enable them to buy new stock, strengthen their business activity and better meet their customers´ needs.

loans.use: to buy ink, decorative Plexiglas® and other products like cans and rice.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 50 years old and married with four children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Tessie runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, sugar, soap, and canned goods.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Albeiro a sus 40 años de edad es padre de 10 hijos de 17, 14, 13, 12, 10, 8, 5, 4, 2 y 3 meses de edad, trabaja día a día arduamente para sacar adelante a su gran familia en su propio cultivo de papa, arveja y fríjol ubicado en su finca en una vereda del municipio de Sonson localizado al norte de Antioquia. En los últimos meses, el señor Albeiro ha tenido dificultades puesto que el invierno ha afectado en gran proporción su cultivo y no ha podido sacar la producción que esperaba, para lo cual necesita de la compra de abonos y riegos que le permitan recuperar su cultivo y la calidad de vida de su familia. El señor Albeiro tiene la esperanza de mejorar su cultivo y brindarle lo necesario para vivir a sus 10 hijos y esposa.
texts.en: Alberio is 40 years old and the father of 10 children, ages 17, 14, 13, 12, 10, 8, 5, 4, 2 and 3 months.  He works arduously on his own potato, pea, and bean crop to move his grand family ahead.  The crops are on his farm on a Sonson veranda, located north of Antioquina.   In the past few months Alberio has had difficulties because the winter has affected his crop and he has not been able to get the production he was hoping for, so he needs to buy fertilizer and pay for irrigation so he can recover his crop and his family’s quality of life.  He hopes to improve his crop and provide for his 10 children’s and his wife’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and irrigation.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: La Sra. María, tiene 30 años y es soltera con 1 hijo de 11 años.  La señora se dedica al Servicio de Peluquería, que se encuentra en el Zona San José Obrero.  Trabaja de lunes a domingo. Este es su primer préstamo,  María va a usar este préstamo para compra de un sillón lava cabeza y otros enseres, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para hacer crecer su negocio. María demuestra ser responsable y muy trabajadora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de herramientas de trabajo, va a utilizar los beneficios en construcción de un cuarto, su sueño de la señora es instalar una sucursal  de su negocio y esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida mediante el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Maria is 30 years old, single, and has an 11 year-old child.  She has a beauty salon that is located 	in the San Jose Obrero neighborhood where she works every day.  This is her first loan.  Maria will use this loan to buy a shampoo chair and other equipment.  She is requesting this loan because she wants to make her business grow.  Maria has proved to be responsible and very hardworking; she faces challenges in her business such as the lack of work tools.  She will use her profits to build a room.  Maria's dream is to open another salon.  She is very grateful to EMPRENDER for their trust in her, and for giving her the opportunity to improve her life through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a shampoo chair and other equipment for her salon

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Monsieur  LASSINE  est âgé de 45 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DONGORONA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
LASSINE n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé premier prêt il est à son deuxième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
LASSINE espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: LASSINE is 45 years old and lives with his six children and his wife in traditional family style, in DONGORONA - one of the villages in the administrative area of Ouelessebougou, in the Koulikoro region. LASSINE did not have the opportunity to attend school. Very early on he became interested in money-making activities, notably the purchase, storage and resale of cereal crops. He learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who was a big cereal trader in his time. With a view to meeting the demands of his growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. Having completed repayment of his first loan, this second personal loan will be used to purchase 2 tonnes of cereals (corn, beans, millet, fonio) from the rural producers in and around DONGORONA; this will then be stored for at least 3 months. He sells mostly in bulk to a customer base made up of resellers from the big cities such as Bamako. LASSINE hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which he will use to repay the loan, and the balance will be re-invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Ma. Liberty

texts.en:
Ma. Liberty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy tables and chairs, and to upgrade her videoke unit.

Ma. Liberty has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending.

Ma. Liberty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, and to upgrade her videoke unit.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, noodles, canned goods, and eggs. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Nianankoro

texts.fr:
Monsieur  NIANANKORO est un homme  qui est âgé de 57  ans et qui vit avec ses 12 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle a DONGORONA un des villages de la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, NIANANKORO, qui n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école, s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage commercialement des céréales et des produits de cueillettes tels le néré, et  le tamarin.  
Nanti  de 8 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, NIANANKORO décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
NIANANKORO  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 10 sacs  d’arachide et 5 sacs de tamarin, auprès des paysans producteurs de SANANKOROBA et de DIALAKOROBA qu’il stockera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il effectue sa vente  au marché de Ouelesseboubou, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
NIANANKORO espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui   sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt,  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
NIANANKORO is a 57 year old man who lives with his family - his wife and his 12 children - in DONGORONA, one of the villages around the town of Ouelessebougou, Kati in the Koulikoro region. In order to have an economic activity, NIANANKORO, who didnt have the opportunity to go to school, rapidly took up the commercial storage of cereals and harvested products such as néré seeds (used for making oil) and tamarinds. Now with 8 years of relevant experience he is much sought after. 
In his search for additional financial resources, NIANANKORO decided to join the credit programme of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution - with whom he is embarking on his second personal loan. NIANANKORO plans to use this loan to purchase 1 tonne of corn, 10 bags of peanuts and 5 bags of tamarinds - from the rural producers from SANANKOROBA and SANANKOROBA. He will stock these for a minimum of 2 months. He sells his merchandise at the market in Ouelesseboubou to a customer base of men and women, for cash and only rarely on credit.
NIANANKORO hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover the family's living expenses, and the remainder will be re-invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Iluminada has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from variety store.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more bananas and ingredients for her food vending.

Felixberta has been in this business for 13 years, and also earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Felixberta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and ingredients for her food vending.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is 22 years old.  She is married and has one child, age 4. 

In 2005, Muna established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Muna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 6 sets of bedsheets and 8 lengths of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SEYDOU   est âgé de 46 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Dongorona, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de OUELESSEBOUGOUi,  Région de Koulikoro.
SEYDOU  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de Dongorona  et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins deux mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
SEYDOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000  FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: SEYDOU is 46 years old and lives with his six children and his wife in traditional family style, in DONGORONA - one of the villages in the administrative area of OUELESSEBOUGOUi, in the Koulikoro region. SEYDOU did not have the opportunity to attend school. Very early on he became interested in money-making activities, notably the purchase, storage and resale of cereal crops. He learned this trade from his maternal uncle, who was a big cereal trader in his time. With a view to meeting the demands of his growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This second personal loan will be used to purchase 2 tonnes of cereals (corn, beans, millet, fonio) from the rural producers in and around DONGORONA; this will then be stored for at least 2 months. He sells mostly in bulk to a customer base made up of resellers from the big cities such as Bamako. SEYDOU hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which he will use to repay the loan, and the balance will be re-invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Elivil

texts.en:
Elivil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food manufacturing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more ingredients to her food manufacturing business.

Elivil has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from a restaurant.

Elivil has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save enough to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her chorizo business.

loans.name: Maelewano Zomboko Group

texts.en:
Chelestina, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee with one child who goes to school. She has been running a pharmacy business since 2006. She works from 7:30 am to 9:00 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees and household expenses, pay for her plot of land, and increase her medicine stock. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan now to increase her medicine stock. Her dream is to one day be able to take her child to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Maelewano Zomboko," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of medicine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anizah

texts.en:
Anizah is 29 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Anizah works very hard to provide for them.

Anizah runs a business of buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future, Anizah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en: Armelinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines for 3 years. Armelinda has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fruits such as apples, oranges, papayas, etc.to sell. In the future, Armelinda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 1 enfant.
Kossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des boissons pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à la brasserie de Lomé. Elle est aidée par une personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir acheter une grande quantité.
Kossiwa a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons en grande quantité. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarisation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Kossiwa, age 28, is married to a reseller and has one child. Since 2008, she's been reselling beverages to a diverse clientele in her shop.

She gets her supplies at a brewery in Lomé. She has one person to help her. At this time, her main difficulty is not being able to purchase large quantities.

Kossiwa is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy a large quantity of beverages. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to secure her child's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL PARAISO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Teodora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida rápida, ferretería de herramientas, tejidos de mantas, hilado de lana de vicuña, tejido de mantas, venta de coca, comercio de ají y otros.

La señora Agustina,  indica que hace un año trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de vent5a de ají y otros que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ají) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The El Paraiso Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. There are eight members in the group led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Teodora. The members have a variety of businesses such as selling fast food, running a hardware store, weaving blankets, spinning yarn from vicuna wool, selling coca leaves, and selling chili peppers.

Sra. Agustina began working with Pro Mujer a year ago. She joined the institution at the invitation of another member. Currently she runs a business selling chili peppers as well as other businesses she has had for several years. 

The loan she is seeking is for working capital so that she can buy more chilis from la Ceja which she will then sell in various markets. The income from her business enables her to support her family; she lives with her partner and their two children. Agustina tells us that she most enjoys the service provided by and the meetings organised by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy chilis

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 23 years old. She is married to a businessman and has three children aged between 2 and 4. She has been selling bread for 3 years. With this loan, she hopes to buy more baking powder to make more bread to sell. Angelique hopes to use the profits generated from this loan to set up another outlet for selling her bread. In the future, she would like to see her business expanding with large capital.

loans.use: To buy more baking powder to make bread.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en: Gerardine is 27 years old and has five children aged between 3 and 5. For the past 3 years, she has worked with her husband selling meat. Geraldine has requested this loan to buy cows for slaughtering to get meat to sell. She expects to use the profits generated from this loan to build another house. She dreams of reaching 2 million RWF of capital.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughtering for meat

loans.name: Caacupe Poty 1 Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva. Ellas están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida. Se encuentran en el ciclo numeron 1 con sus 12 integrantes.
Una de las miembros es la señora Virginia, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la costura. Ella por medio de su arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, cubriendo los gastos que surgen. Ella se define como una persona humilde, honesta y muy luchadora, desea poder seguir creciendo para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Virginia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women who belong to this group are from the town of Caacupé. They are very happy with the support they receive from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. They are expanding their small businesses and increasing their income which provides them with a better standard of living.

One of the members is Sra. Virginia who is a seamstress. Because of this difficult job she has been able to help her family get ahead and cover household costs. She calls herself a simple, honest, and hardworking woman who wishes to continue growing her business so she can help her family. Virginia is seeking a loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other supplies so she can fulfill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 used tires and tubes for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Octave

texts.en: Octave is married to a farmer and the couple has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 19. Octave has been selling maize flour, sugar and sodas for 8 years. He has requested this loan to buy more sugar, maize flour and sodas. He plans to use the profits generated from this loan for savings. He dreams of reaching a certain level of achievement.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Leniya

texts.en:
Leniya is 49 years old and married. She has six children, age 8 to 26. Three of her children go to school. 

With the loan she will buy more sorghum. She expects to use the profits to buy iron sheets for her house. She would like to be a distributor of sorghum.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 29 years old. She is married and has two children age 8 months and 2 years old. Neither attends school. 

She has been selling various items for five years. She has requested the loan to buy more items such as rice, potatoes and biscuits. With the profits, she will buy a plot of land for her residence.

loans.use: To buy more rice, potatoes and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 37 years old. She is married and has three children, age 18, 15 and 13.  

In 2004, she established  her fruit shop business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy various fruits for her business.  

Krishna will use the Kiva loan to buy various fruits and a juicer machine. She uses her income in the education of her children. 

In the future, Krishna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buys fruits for her business.

loans.name: Gnonnamahouton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GNONNAMAHOUTON  est formé de trois  personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe d'artisans. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Sèdohouè Etienne, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sèdohouè Etienne est marié à une marchande du nom de Félicienne. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Sèdohouè Etienne vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les diverses charges de la famille. Sèdohouè Etienne a arrêté l'école au cours primaire et a appris la maçonnerie, activité qu'il exerce depuis une dizaine d'année. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Sèdohouè Etienne désire acquérir des moules métalliques. Pour ce faire, Sèdohouè Etienne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GNONNAMAHOUTON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group Gnonnamahouton is made up of three people who all come from the same group of artisans.  The representative of the group, Sèdohouè Etienne, is the one with his hand raised in the photo.  This is the third time that the group has applied for financial support from ALIDé in order to raise their level of business.  Sèdohouè Etienne is married to a merchant whose name is Félicienne.  The couple has five children, all of whom are in school and in the care of their parents.  Besides their own children, the couple has another child in their care.  Sèdohouè Etienne lives together with his wife and children, and provides for the diverse needs of his family along with his wife.  Sèdohouè Etienne left school at the primary level and learned masonry,  an occupation he has held for some twelve years.  With the goals of a more highly satisfied customer base and revenue growth, Sèdohouè Etienne would like to acquire metal molds.  To do this, Sèdohouè Etienne is requesting, along with the other members of the Gnonnamahouton group, a third loan from ALIDé.  The first two loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: To purchase metal molds.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Delfina;  La socia tiene 24 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 4 meses de edad; La socia es docente de profesión y trabaja en una comunidad alejada en el nivel primario, la socia en esta semana entra de vacaciones hasta el mes de abril, la socia desea invertir su tiempo estos meses e invertir en un pequeño negocio en casa, ella pondra un emporio de venta de pollos, la socia comprara pollos y los vendera crudos en su emporio. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de pollos e implementar su negocio.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Delfina belongs to the Qori Orcco Community Bank located in Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco. 

She is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 4-month old son. Delfina is a primary school teacher in a remote community. This week she is starting vacations which will last until April. She wishes to use these months to start a small business in her home selling chickens. Delfina will buy chickens and then sell them uncooked. She is seeking a loan so she can buy chickens and begin her business.

Delfina is grateful for the laon and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy chickens and start her business

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: La Sra. Benjamina   es viuda, tiene 4 hijos, Benjamina tiene 50 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “La inmaculada Concepcion” grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Benjamina   trabaja desde hace 19  años en la venta de abarrotes en un puesto en el mercado  este negocio surge porque a raíz de que su esposo falleció, ella tenía que mantener a sus cuatro hijos. Es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar  adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo dulces poco a poco fue creciendo su capital y lo invirtió en arroz leche fideos  a su vez también vende marciano, helados, chupetes en verano. gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar Insumos(Arroz, Fideos, Leche) .Sabemos que Benjamina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Benjamina is divorced.  She has four children and is 50 years old.  Currently she is a member of La Inmaculada Concepción communal bank group, made up of nine members who work in various business activities.

Benjamina has been working for 19 years selling groceries in a stall in the market.  This business came up because her husband died.  She needed to support her four children.  So she worked very hard to get her family ahead.  She began selling sweets.  Little by little she grew her capital and invested it in rice, milk, and vermicelli.  Occasionally she also sells "marcianos" [ice pops in a plastic tube], ice cream, and ice pops in the summer.

Thanks to her effort and dedication she has gotten better economic income.  Her children managed to study.  Little by little she bought things for her home and above all her family has a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, she has requested a new loan to buy supplies (rice, vermicelli, milk).

We know that Benjamina will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that the EDAPROSPO loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies: milk, rice, and vermicelli

loans.name: Dil Kumari

texts.en:
Dil Kumari is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, age 25 and 23.  

In 1998, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  

In the future, Dil Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. 

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Oscar Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Oscar es cliente nuevo en la institución se dedica a la costura de variedad de  ropa en el taller que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio en la zona villa Nuevo Potosí vive con su esposa en la casa de sus suegros no tienen hijos por el momento pero ese es su deseo poder agrandar la familia,  el crédito esta destinado para la compra de rollos de tela por mayor  fibra , polar y una maquina recta mas adelante piensan en comprar una maquina de bordar y una computadora para tener un taller completo de costura y bordados, es un joven muy trabajador ya esta es su única actividad para mantener a su familia, con el tiempo desea expandir sus productos a las distintas ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro.
texts.en:
Oscar is a new client of the institution.  He works sewing a variety of clothes in a workshop in his own home in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area.  He lives with his wife in the house of his in-laws.  They do not have children at present, but that is their desire, to expand the family.

The loan will be used to buy wholesale rolls of fabric, polar fleece, and an upright machine.  Later on he plans to buy an embroidery machine and a computer to have a complete sewing and embroidery workshop.

He is a very hardworking young man.  This is his only work to support his family.  In time he wants to expand his products to the different cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rolls of fabric and an upright sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Marwin

texts.es:
Marwin tiene una microempresa dedicada a la fabricación y venta de artículos de cuero, especialmente de  bolsos y sus accesorios. El posee las líneas de: bolso baúl sintético, bolso manos libres y bolsos de cuero. Su negocio está ubicado en  una casa arrendada, en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla. El taller ocupa la sala-comedor, y el empresario reside en el resto de la casa. Sus ventas las realiza al por mayor, de contado y a crédito, a almacenes del norte y centro de Barranquilla.   Genera 6 empleos, incluyéndolo  él de él. Antes de emprender su negocio, era empleado en una empresa que elaboraba artículos de cuero. Además su padre lo inició en esta actividad, desde los 13 años de edad. Poco a poco ha comprado sus máquinas, con lo que ha consolidado una buena infraestructura física, con la que ha sido capaz de sostener a su familia. Sus   estados financieros reflejan una situación económica estable, con un inventario de materias primas aceptable, cuentas por cobrar con plazos relativamente cortos. Sus activos fijos muestran máquinas costosas, que le permiten elaborar sus bolsos con gran calidad y excelente acabado. Sus índices son excelentes, con un capital de trabajo adecuado y con rentabilidad normal, ajustado a lo que realmente genera este tipo de negocios
En la actualidad su para capital de trabajo  no es suficiente para lograr las expectativas de trabajo y crecimiento que él tiene , porque sus ventas se incrementan en el mes de Diciembre y debe prepararse para ello, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva,primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará materias primas, como cuero, cuerina, goma, herrajes, al por mayor y de contado, con el fin de aprovechar esta época de ventas altas, y así incrementar los ingresos y utilidades en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marwin has a microbusiness dedicated to making and selling leather goods, especially bags and accessories for them.  He has lines of synthetic box bags, shoulder bags, and leather bags.

His business is located in a rented house in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood to the south of the city of Barranquilla.  The workshop is in the living-dining room and the businessman lives in the rest of the house.  He sells wholesale (in cash and on credit) to warehouses in the north and center of Barranquilla.  He generates six jobs, including his own.  Before setting up his business he was an employee of a company that made leather goods.  His father also got him started in this work, from the time he was 13.

Little by little he has bought his machines and so consolidated a good physical infrastructure, with which he has been able to support his family.  His financial condition reflects a stable economic situation with an acceptable inventory of raw materials and short-term accounts receivable.  His fixed assets are costly machines that allow him to make his bags with great quality and excellent finish.  His rates are excellent, with adequate working capital and normal profitability, adjusted to what this type of business really generates.

Currently he does not have enough working capital to meet his work and growth prospects, because his sales grow in the month of December and he needs to get ready for that.  This is why he is turning to a Kiva loan, the first funding he is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With the loan he will buy materials such as leather, imitation leather, rubber, and hardware, wholesale and in cash, with the goal of taking advantage of this season of high sales and so increase his income and profits in his business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, imitation leather, rubber, and hardware.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: La señora Diana tiene una bodega desde hace cuatro años en la cual distribuye cerveza en el municipio de San Rafael localizado al oriente de Antioquia, ha presentado dificultades en el abastecimiento de su bodega puesto que la vía de acceso al municipio ha permanecido cerrada por el invierno varios días lo que le ha generado escasez de producto y bajas ventas. La señora Diana requiere de la compra de una estantería que le facilite un mayor almacenamiento de producto y así poder surtir en mayor cantidad su bodega y no tener que sufrir con el cierre de la carretera. La señora Diana sueña con tener una gran distribuidora a nivel departamental y brindarle a sus hijos y esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
For four years Diana has had a warehouse in which she distributes beer, in the town of San Rafael located to the east of Antioquía.  This has presented difficulties in storage because the access road to the town has remained closed for several days because of winter, which has caused product shortages and low sales.

Diana needs to buy shelves that will allow her greater storage of her product, and in that way she will be able to supply her warehouse with greater quantities and not have to suffer from the highway closure.

Diana dreams of having a large, department-wide distribution company and of giving her children and her husband a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shelves for her products in the distribution company

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: Auxiliadora tiene una actividad económica que es una pulpería, en lo cual ella tiene productos de consumo diario en su negocio. Auxiliadora no es la primera vez que tiene crédito con la institución, ya que ella ha sido una excelente cliente. Auxiliadora  nos explica que con el  financiamiento que le hemos brindando a aumentado su mercadería y junto con ello sus clientes. Auxiliadora está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio con la compra de :  golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, jabón, pasta de diente entre otros.
texts.en: Auxiliadora has a convenience store where she sells necessities.  This is not the first time Auxiliadora has had a loan with the institution since she has been an excellent client.  She tells us that because of the financing she has been able to increase the merchandise and thus bring in more customers.  Auxiliadora is requesting a loan to buy: sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, soap, toothpaste, etc

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es una mujer empeñosa y dedicada, a diario ella se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y sandalias en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada en el sur del Perú, un oasis extenso y seco ubicado en el desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas. El microfinanciamiento permite a las personas que no tienen muchos recursos y cuentan con un pequeño negocio tener una oportunidad como negociante en el mercado laboral.

Su esposo es maestro de construcción lo que le permite tener un mayor incremento de ingresos en su hogar, este dinero está destinado a la inversión de su pequeño negocio y la educación y cuidado de sus pequeños hijos, uno de apenas 2 años de edad y el mayor de 8. Ella nos comenta que uno de sus platos favoritos en el “Chupe de Camarones”, en la ciudad de Camaná es más fácil poder degustar de este sabroso plato debido a que esta se encuentra muy cerca al mar, lo que permite garantizar la frescura del producto.

Leonarda es una mujer que trabaja en promedio 11 horas diarias y esto le permite obtener una ganancia de S/.130 diarios, con este dinero ella puede pagar el costo original de los zapatos, ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes y por su gran carisma. Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar nueva mercadería para vender, lo que le permitirá mayor atención por parte de sus clientes y en consecuencia mejores ingresos. Su sueño es poder ampliar el tamaño de su pequeño negocio y así lograr incrementar sus ingresos para poder techar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Leonarda is a hard-working and dedicated woman. She sells shoes and sandals every day in the city of Camaná, located in the south of Peru. This area is a vast and dry oasis in the Desierto de Sechura, which dominates the south-eastern coast of the country. Camaná has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru. However, the frequent and strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the past decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, destroyed the tourist industry in Camaná, as well as jobs, livelihoods, and homes. The result of this unemployment has been the creation of an atmosphere ripe for microfinancing. Microfinancing gives people with small businesses and few resources business opportunities in the labour market.

Leonarda's husband is a master builder, and this brings in a good income. They use this money to invest in the small business, as well as in the care and education of their little children. The youngest is barely two years old, and the oldest is 8. Leonarda tells us that one of her favourite dishes is “Chupe de Camarones” [Shrimp Chowder]. In Camaná it is easy to find and enjoy this delicious dish because they are very close to the sea--this guarantees the freshness of the product.

Leonarda is a woman who works an average of eleven hours a day. This allows her to make 130 Soles per day. With this money, she is able to pay the original cost of the shoes. She thinks that her business is successful because she provides good customer service and is very charismatic. Thanks to the Kiva lenders, she will be able to buy new merchandise to sell. This will allow her to provide better customer service, thus making a better income. Her dream is to be able to expand the size of her business and therefore increase her income in order to be able to thatch the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda, de 34 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos, quienes aún son menores y dependen de ellos para su educación y alimentación, ellos viven en una casa propia desde donde todos los días salen a trabajar para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Aleyda consiste en la compra y venta de pescado, y lo hace de manera ambulante, distribuye a sus caseros su producto, el cual compra a precios muy cómodos. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Cuando se inicio en este negocio tenía muchas dificultades en encontrar el pescado adecuado o el producto que este en mejores condiciones, pero con el tiempo aprendió, tanto así que ahora es una de las mejores vendedoras de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y bromear entre ellas, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que éste se le pega en la ropa y prácticamente tiene que soportarlo todo el día. Espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender sus pescado sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este será el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria. Espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más productos (pescados de todo tipo) para ofrecer en mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aleyda  is 34 years old.  She is a good, friendly woman.  She is married and the mother of four children who are still minors and depend on her for their education and sustenance.  They live in their own house and every day she goes to work in order to give her family a better quality of life.  

Aleyda buys and sells fish as a street vendor for a living.  She delivers her products, which she purchases at affordable prices, to people's homes.  She has many customers since she sells the freshest fish and she is a cheerful saleswoman who always greets her customers with a smile.  When she started this business it was very difficult for her to find suitable fish or a product that was in good condition.  She has learned a lot over time and now she is one of the best vendors in the region.  

Conversing and joking with her customers is what she likes most about her job.  She has been doing this for 14 years and she considers the odor from the fish the most difficult thing to bear as it sticks to her clothes and she has to bear it most of the day.  In the future, she hopes to have a small refrigerator from which she can sell her fish without fear that it will go bad in the heat of the sun. 

This will be her 13th loan with MFP.  She has always been a good member of her communal bank where they love her very much because she is very responsible and supportive.  She hopes that she will get this loan which will be backing for her and she will be able to continue growing her business.  She believes that she will continue being a very punctual member and will make her payments on time like she did with all her previous loans.  

With the 1500 soles [Peruvian currency] requested she will buy more products (all types of fish) so she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: purchase a diverse variety of fish.

loans.name: Wiwe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WIWE est formé de trois  personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Noudéhouénou Maxime, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Noudéhouénou Maxime est âgé de 24 ans et est  marié à une revendeuse du nom de Grâce. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Noudéhouénou Maxime vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la famille. Noudéhouénou Maxime a arrêté l'école au cours primaire, puis a appris le métier de vitrier. Il y a cinq ans que Noudéhouénou Maxime mène cette activité. Parallèlement, Noudéhouénou Maxime vend des chaussures et des friperies dans sa région. Noudéhouénou Maxime s'approvisionne au Togo et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Noudéhouénou Maxime sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WIWE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Wiwe group is made up of three people who come from the same tontine, or savings group.  The representative of the group, named Noudéhouénou Maxime, is the one with his hand raised in the photo.  This is the first time that the group has applied for financial support from ALIDé, in the hope of raising their level of business.  Noudéhouénou Maxime is 24 years old, and is married to a retailer named Grâce.  The couple cares for three children, two of whom are their own.  Among the children, some are in school.  Noudéhouénou Maxime lives together with his wife and children, and, along with his wife, provides for the diverse needs of his family.  Noudéhouénou Maxime left school at the primary level and then learned the glazier trade.  For five years, Noudéhouénou Maxime has run this business.  At the same time, Noudéhouénou Maxime sells shoes and second-hand clothing in the region.  Noudéhouénou Maxime stocks up in Togo and Nigeria.  With the goals of a more highly satisfied customer base and revenue and sales growth, Noudéhouénou Maxime is requesting his first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the Wiwe group.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PALMERAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, chiflera y amautas, atención de llamadas, comidera, artesana de chompas, venta de velas.

La señora Juana,  indica que es la primera vez trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años y aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de viveres) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.

En la fotografía no esta la señora Raquel, ya que se tuvo que ir con urgencia a su fuente laboral.
texts.en:
The “LAS PALMERAS” group will start their first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Panamericana Focal Center. This group has 6 members and is headed by a board of directors with Ms. Juana as the treasurer. The women have a variety of businesses.  Among them are: blanket weaving, amautas and chiflera (natural healing), telephone answering service, operating a diner, making handcrafted sweaters, and selling candles.

Juana said that this is the first time she has worked in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution by invitation. Currently she owns a business selling food, which she learned from her family and has done for years. 

The loan that she will take out will be used to grow her capital (to buy supplies) which she will acquire from Ceja.  Subsequent to the development, she will commercialize her sales post. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is tired and has three children.  

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her response was that she enjoys the meetings.  

Ms. Raquel is not pictured because she had to go quickly due to an emergency situation.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Teriya (Amitié) Group

texts.fr:
Teriya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 53 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe Teriya fait l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques, d’habillements, de condiments alimentaires et de la restauration.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a huit ans. 
Souaré,  qui est un des membres fait l’achat et la vente des habits. Elle est assise au milieu de la photo, habillée en grand boubou vert. Elle porte des marchandises sur ses pieds (des pagnes) et un collier au tour du cou.
