She alternates her daily household chores with her work.  She’s a teacher working at one of Calca’s most popular schools.  She’s been in this profession for 27 years and does very well.  Her second economic activity is selling cosmetics of the Avon, Esika and Duppre brands, for example.  


She’s been in this small business for four years now and does very well but, seeing that her clientele is growing, she needs to buy more products and this is the reason for her loan request to increase working capital.  She wants to buy an assortment of products like perfume, lipstick, necklaces, watches and other things.  

María Jesús’ dream is to build a hotel in the city of Calca because many tourists come to the zone and need lodging.  María Jesús is a member of the “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” which has 15 members living in the city of Calca, Calca Province and Cusco Department, Perú.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina cuenta con 37 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos y esta en espera de otro sus hijos están estudiando Kenia estudia la prepa, cristal estudia 6° de primaria y norbelio esta en 3° de preescolar, su esposo se llama norbelio es campesino.

Ella es comerciante tiene una tienda de abarrotes ya tiene dos años con su tienda, Delfina invertirá su préstamo en la compra de productos de abarrotes como son: detergente, refrescos, agua, leche, etc. Pues doña delfina dice que le esta hechando todas las ganas para que su negocio crezca mas ya que lo quiere incrementar mas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 37 years old, married, has three children and is expecting another one.  Her children are attending school.  Kenia is in high school, Cristal is in 6th grade and Norbelio is in 3rd year of Preschool.  Her husband’s name is Norbelio and he’s a farmer.

She is a merchant.  She’s had a grocery store for two years and she will use her loan to buy grocery items like detergent, soft-drinks, water, milk, etc. because Delfina says that she’s putting her all into it so that the business grows more because she wants to expand it.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some liquids she uses and to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es: Jene es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Don Bosco” grupo conformado por 10 socios comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad. Hace  más de 04 años Jene trabaja en un consultorio dental como asistente, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido aportar con los gastos del hogar, y de este modo apoyar a su madre ya que nos manifiesta que le ha  comprado  una salchipapera la cual trabaja vendiendo frituras (alita broster, hamburguesas, salchipapas). Uno de sus sueños de Jene es de instalar en su domicilio un restaurante donde pueda brindar variedades de platos típicos pues así asegura que tendrá  mayores ganancias. Con el crédito que solicito piensa seguir apoyando a su mamá con los insumos como papa, pollo, aceite y cubiertos. La Alcancía Comunal “Don Bosco” están muy agradecidos con el Programa- Prosperidad ya que hacen posible su progreso. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a Jene, ella es la que viste una chompa blanca y  está ubicada en la parte posterior.
texts.en:
Jene’s a member of the “Don Bosco” communal bank, a group of ten members committed to the Programa-Prosperidad.  Jene has worked for four years as an assistant in a dental office.  Thanks to her work and her effort she’s been able to contribute to household expenses and help her mother.  She tells us that she bought her a “salchipapera” [cart to prepare and sell salchipapas-fried potatoes with fried potatoes] that she uses to sell fast food (Broaster-style chicken wings, hamburgers, salchipapas).  

One of Jene’s dreams is to set up a restaurant at home where she can offer a variety of traditional dishes because she is sure her profits will be better that way.  She plans to use the requested loan to continue to help her mother with ingredients like potatoes, chicken, oil and place settings.

The “Don Bosco” communal bank is very grateful to the Programa-Prosperidad because it makes their progress possible.  In the photo we can see Jene wearing a white sweater; she’s located in the rear.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, oil and place settings.

loans.name: Luz De Campo Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Luz De campo esta conformadas por Anastasia Basilisa, Antonio, Nubia, Leyla Victoria, Maria Eusebia, Nicolasa, Luz Mila, Julia Yamileth, Candida Natalia, Tomasa, Verania todos estos 11 emprendedores exitosos que con su perseverancia ha logrado salir adelante. 

Nicolasa Danelia es una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía que es un actividad económica tradicional, ya que es muy buscada por los turistas y nacionales  de la región. Leyla Victoria también se dedica a la venta y compra de artesanía ella están solicitando financiamiento para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las artesanías.
texts.en:
The “Luz de Campo” communal bank’s members are: Anastasia Basilisa, Antonio, Nubia, Leyla Victoria, Maria Eusebia, Nicolasa, Luz Mila, Julia Yamileth, Cándida Natalia, Tomasa and Verania.  All eleven are successful, enterprising people who thanks to their perseverance have succeeded in getting ahead.

Nicolasa Daniela is a young entrepreneur who buys and sells crafts which is a traditional economic activity very sought after by locals and tourists alike in the region.  Leyla Victoria also buys and sells crafts and they are seeking financing to buy materials to make the crafts.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, de 56 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, esta casada y con Eduardo de 67 años, han sido compañeros por mucho tiempo y esperan continuar juntos para así poder tener una vejez tranquila. El trabajo de Dolores consiste en la venta de comida de todo tipo ya que posee un gran don, el de tener manos mágicas ya que posee una de las mejores sazones de la ciudad, su restaurante es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy buena y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina. Aún recuerda cuando se inicio y empezó con su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante. Al principio le fue complicado ya que tenía que ganar terreno en un gran mercado, pero con el tiempo lo logró. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola. Para más adelante, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante, además comprar más menajes. Este será el crédito número 6 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con los 700 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar, ya que la demanda por su comida ha aumentado, además de comprar platos, tenedores y cuchillos.
texts.en:
Dolores, 56, is a good, kind woman married to Eduardo, 67.  They have been companions for a long time and expect to continue together into a tranquil old age.  

Dolores’ work consists in selling all types of food because she has a great gift: magic hands since she makes some of the city’s tastiest food.  Her restaurant is one of the most popular in the city of Pucallpa.  Every day her customers meet in her restaurant to enjoy the delicious menus she prepares.  She is a very good cook and she’s loved cooking since she was a little girl.  She still remembers when she started out with her great dream of having a restaurant.  At the beginning it was complicated because she had to win over a market share in this very large market.  But in time, she managed to do so.

What she enjoys the most about her work is cooking which she does with much dedication.  She’s been in business 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to tend to all the people who come to the restaurant because often she has to work by herself.  For later on, she’d like to improve her restaurant’s infrastructure as well as to buy more furnishings.

This will be MFP loan #6.  She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support to continue increasing her working capital.  In addition, she’s convinced that she will continue to be a good member who is responsible with her previous loans.  She likes belonging to the communal bank she works in because they are all responsible and very mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 700 new soles to buy ingredients to cook since demand for her meals has increased.  She will also buy plates, forks and knives.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients she uses.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tienen seis hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes, uno de sus hijos falleció hace varios años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.  Su esposo es chofer. Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la ciudad hace varios años atrás.

Ella es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, cose todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más confecciona son sabanas ya que son muy solicitados por sus clientes y es lo que más ganancias le deja, una vez que ha confeccionado sus sabanas las lleva a entregar a un local en la ciudad, trabaja a base de  pedidos de estos locales y de personas particulares que desean sus servicios. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00. Ella tiene más de 18 años con su taller y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  emplear en compra telas, hilos, y otros materiales para la  costura. Lleva 15 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que presta la institución para dar los créditos. 
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Picoaza is listed in the books as one of the aboriginal towns in the Manteña culture. This urban parish is located only ten minutes from the capital of Portoviejo. Manabita is full of many stories. The members of Banco Comunal María Asunción meet here every 2 weeks. 

Shirley lives in this place. She is 53 years old. She is married and they have six adult children who are independent. One of them died some years ago. Two of them still live at home. Her husband is a driver. She learned dressmaking in an academy in the city a few years ago.

She is a dressmaker and has a small sewing workshop at home. She sews all types of clothing but mostly what she makes are bed sheets as this is what is most requested by her customers and it is what gives her the most profit. Once she has made the sheets she delivers them to a facility in the city, filling the request of those that desire this service.

She works every day from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. She has had her workshop for more than 18 years and is doing very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies. She has been with the communal bank for 15 years and she likes it for the lending facilities that the institution has for granting loans.

Her dream is to get ahead and to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Juana Eduriges

texts.es: Juana Eduriges tiene 36 años de edad, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida, es una mujer emprendedora que ha sabido salir adelante ella y sus hijos. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, cremas, ropa en general y prendas de oro y plata. Sueña con lograr incrementar su inventario cada día más y brindarle a sus clientes una excelente atención ofreciéndole variedad de producto.
texts.en: Juan Eduriges, 36, works selling general merchandise.  She has had this livelihood for more than three years.  She is an enterprising woman who has learned how to get herself and her children ahead.  The objective of the loan she is requesting is to buy footwear, perfume, creams, clothing in general, and gold and silver accessories.  She dreams about managing to increase her inventory more every day and giving her customers excellent service by offering them a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy footwear, perfume, creams, clothing, and gold and silver accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household articles to sell.

loans.name: Griselda  Cristiana

texts.es:
La señora Griselda Cristina es  una señora humilde, alegre trabajadora  con deseos de tener u mejor futuro en su comunidad.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Juan Omar un señor trabajador se dedica a la albañilería desde hace  siete años.
Tiene un hijo  quien le ayuda en su negocio de la venta de pollos, ya que va entregar los pedidos  y a cobrar.
Doña Griselda nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio  es pelar los pollos y limpiarlos.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de  más pollos para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo  que le ha dado para seguir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Griselda Cristiana is a modest, happy, and hardworking woman who wants to have a better future in her community.  She is happily married to Juan Omar, a hardworking man who has worked in construction for seven years.  She has a son who helps her in her business selling chickens, since he goes out to deliver the orders and collect payment.  Griselda tells us that what she likes most about her business is plucking and cleaning the chickens.

She requested the loan to buy more chickens to sell.

She thanks the foundation for the support it has given her to get ahead and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chili seeds to sow.

loans.name: Adriana Rocio

texts.es:
La señorita Adriana Rocio es trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de calzados por catalogo de las marcas: Andrea, clacks y flexi y kínder  marcas mexicanas para generas más empleos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar más calzado para la venta  ya que el calzado se vende bien en su localidad y en localidades  vecinas.
Ella nos cuenta que le gusta su negocio por que genera más empleos  y por que  ayuda alas personas que no tiene para comprar calzado al contado ya que ella los vende en pagos  semanales o quincenales.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla  y por creer en ella  y apoyarla en lo que se pueda.
texts.en:
Señorita Adriana Rocio is hard-working. She sells shoes through a catalogue from the following brands: Andrea, Clacks, Flexi and Kinder. These are Mexican brands and generate employment in Mexico.
She requested this loan for the purchase of more shoes for sale, since shoes sell well in her area and in the neighbouring areas.
She tells us that she enjoys her business because it generates employment and helps people who don't have cash to buy shoes; she takes weekly and bi-monthly payments
She thanks the Fundacion for helping her, believing in her, and supporting her where they can.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase books for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chili seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase chilies and chili seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chiles, onions, tomatoes, oil, vegetables, meats and lard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Yenni Asuncion

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yenni, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores y uno de 11 años de edad, todos viven con ella y estudian dos en universidad y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es jardinero.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que además tiene una pequeña ferretería, allí vende productos   como tubos, material para instalaciones sanitaras, eléctricas, de arreglos de casa y muchas otras cosas de ferretería,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan cuando están desocupados,  tiene en su negocio ya por 10 años y dice que  este negocio lo heredo de su papá que falleció y después de esto le dejo su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio, va a comprar, tubos, materiales eléctricos, sanitarios y materiales para construcción. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal,  es la fiscal de reglamentos del grupo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son excelentes personas.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Picoaza is listed in the books as one of the aboriginal towns in the Manteña culture. This urban parish is located only ten minutes from the capital of Portoviejo. Manabita is full of many stories. The members of Banco Comunal María Asunción meet here every 2 weeks. 

In this place we meet Yenni, who is 47 years old and married. They have three children, two older ones and one who is 11 years old. All of them live with her and are students, two are in university and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a gardener.

She is a good housewife and she also has a small hardware shop. There she sells products such as pipes, supplies for bathroom installations, electrical goods, and household repairs and many other hardware items. She works every day from 6:00AM until 10:00PM and sometimes later. Her children and her husband help her when they are unemployed. She has had her shop for ten years and she says that she inherited this business from her father who died and left it to her.

The money from this loan is going to be used to supply her store. She is going to buy pipes, electrical goods, bathroom and construction materials. She is a founding member of the communal bank. She likes the financial regulations of the group because her partners are good people.

Her goal is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy pipes, electrical supplies, bathroom and building materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora  Ana. Tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya todas son mayores de edad, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ella, solo un nieto que es como su propio hijo que tiene 13 años y estudia en colegio, su marido es taxista.

Ella tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y venta de comidas rápidas, tiene su negocio hace tres años y le ha ido bien ya que en el sector es la única cabina telefónica y muchas personas acuden a su local, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 23h00, trabaja sola y comparte su tiempo de trabajo con los del hogar ya que su negocio está en la casa donde ella alquila, en la actualidad está construyendo su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar tarjetas y recargas telefónicas para servir mejor a sus clientes. Lleva  11 años en el Banco Comunal le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes en su vida y su negocio. 

Su sueño es terminar su casa y poner sus cabinas allí para no pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
Picoaza is recorded in the books as one of the aboriginal towns belonging to the Manteña culture. An urban parish located just ten minutes from the capital city of Portoviejo, Manabita is full of many stories.  The members of the María Asunción Communal Bank meet here every fifteen days.  

Ana, who is 56 years old, lives in this town.  She is in a common-law relationship and has seven children, who are all already adults.  None of her children live with her but her 13 year old grandson does.  He is a student and is like her own son.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  

She has a telephone service and sells fast food.  She has had her business for three years. She has done well since hers are the only phone booths in the sector and many people go to her local. She works every day from 8:00 am to 11:00 pm.  She works alone and shares her time between her business and her household chores as her business is located is in the house where she rents. Currently, she is building a house.  

The purpose of this loan is to buy phone cards and chargers to better serve her customers. She has been a member of the communal bank for 11 years and likes the organization because the loans are very important in her life and her business. Her dream is to finish her house and install her cabins there rather than pay rent.

loans.use: to purchase phone cards and chargers.

loans.name: Carlina Del Rosario

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Carlina, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante y albañil.

Ella es una ama de casa que al ver que lo que hace su esposo no le alcanza para los gastos familiares, se dedico al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los mas que todo en las mañanas ya que en la tarde llegan sus hijos de la escuela y ella tiene que ayudarles en sus tareas y cuidarlos también, compra su mercadería en Portoviejo y en otros casos en Guayaquil, depende de donde le salga más barato, lleva más de 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y en especial ropa de niños que es lo que más vende. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace más de 15 años y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos puede sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
Picoaza is characterized in books as one of the indigenous villages that is part of the Manta culture.  This urban parish is located only ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has an abundance of history.  The members of the communal bank María Asunción meet here bimonthly.  

This is where Carlina lives.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children ages 12 and 8 with her husband.  Both of her children attend school.  Her husband is a merchant and a bricklayer.  

She is a homemaker.  When she realized that her husband's income would not cover the family expenses she started selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door.  She works mostly in the mornings since her children come home in the afternoon and she has to help them with their homework and take care of them.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and sometimes in Guayaquil, depending on where it is cheaper.  She has been running this business for 8 years and things are going well for her.  
 
She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and especially children's clothing which is what she sells the most of.  She has been a member of the communal bank for more than 15 years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to get ahead in her business.  

Her dream is to have a well-constructed house as the one she has now is made of reeds.

loans.use: purchase pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Deisy Leonor

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Deisy. Tiene 47 años de edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos de 23, 18 y 17 años de edad todos viven con ella y estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. 

Ella además de ser una gran madre para ganarse la vida y la de sus hijos después de que se separo puso un negocio de cibercafé en su casa, allí  también vende helados, sodas y bocadillos de picar, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00,  tiene muchos clientes como por ejemplo estudiantes que llegan  a hacer consultas o trabajos en las maquinas, lleva casi dos años con este negocio y  poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando con el paso de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar útiles escolares y CD que necesitan sus clientes. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Picoaza figures in the books as one of the aboriginal towns of the Manteño culture.  This urban parish located only 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabí, is full of history and stories.  The members of María Asunción Communal Bank meet here every two weeks.

We met Deisy here.  She is 47 years old and separated.  She has three children, ages 23, 18, and 17, all of whom live with her and study in the university, and the youngest in high school.

Besides being an excellent mother for making a living for herself and her children, after she separated, she set up a cybercafe in her house.  She also sells ice cream, soda, and snacks there.  She works every day from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.  She has a lot of customers, for example students who come to use the computers for research or papers.  She has had the business for almost two years, and little by little she has expanded over time.

She is going to use this loan to buy school supplies and CDs that her customers need.  She has been with the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because of the help they give with the loans.

Her dream is for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and CDs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en la ciudad de Calca en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas al noroeste de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 57 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su negocio, ella se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. Ya son 10 años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien. Juana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia por ejemplo está apoyando a su hijo que está estudiando la carrera profesional de derecho en una de las universidades de la ciudad del Cusco.   Juana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento balanceado y proteínas para sus animalitos. El Sueño de Juana es abrir un restaurante turístico en su domicilio porque hay mucha visita de turistas al Valle Sagrado de los Incas. 

Juana es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Juana was born in the city of Calca, which is located in the Valle Sagrado de los Incas to the northeast of Cusco.  She is 57 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her household chores with her business.  She raises small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, and pigs.  She has been in this business for 10 years already and it’s going very well.  Juana is a hard-working, enterprising woman who gets her family ahead.  For example, she is supporting her son who is studying for a law degree at one of the universities in Cusco.  At this time, Juana needs the loan to buy balanced feed and protein for her small animals.  Juana’s dream is to open a restaurant in her home because many tourists visit the Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Juana is a member of the “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” group, which is comprised of 15 members who live in the city and province of Calca, department of Peru.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and protein for her small animals.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has two children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Angelina is a farmer who grows coconut trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for their coconut trees.
  
Angelina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Angelina hopes to expand her farm and continuously support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for their coconut trees.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la ciudad de Calca en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas al noroeste de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 67 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su negocio, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de maíz y alfalfa. Ya son 40 años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien. Martha en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas para sembrar. El Sueño de Martha comprar varios terrenos para cultivar mas maíz y alfalfa. 

Martha es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Martha was born in the city of Calca in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, which lies to the northeast of the city of Cusco.  She is 67 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her activities in the home with her business buying and selling corn and alfalfa.  She has been doing this work for 40 years already, and it is going very well.  At this time, Martha needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer and seeds to plant.  Martha's dream is to buy some plots of land so that she can cultivate more corn and alfalfa.

Martha is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Asunta de Calca,” which is made up of 15 members who live in the city of Calca, in Calca province in the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is single and lives in Cabal-asan, Maria, Siquijor. 

To earn a living, Joel is engaged in growing pigs and has had this business for one year.  

Each month, he earns about PHP 3,000 doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeds, medicines and farm supplies for his pig raising business.

Joel has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Joel would like to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, medicines and farm supplies for his pig raising business.

loans.name: Karina Yoconda

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar conocimos a la  señora Karina tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 20, 13 y 6 años de edad, todos viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela, su marido es chofer.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica a la comercio,  tiene un local  en su casa en el cual vende agua en bidón, sodas, jugos y otras bebidas, ella además de vender en su local también entrega a domicilio estos productos, pues cuenta con un carro en el cual realiza sus entregas, algunas veces le ayuda uno de sus hijos y otras veces trabaja sola. Lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar agua en bidón, sodas, jugos entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 11 años y está muy contenta con la ayuda que ha recibido de la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Picoaza is recorded in books as being one of the aboriginal towns from the Manteña culture. This urban parish is situated just ten minutes from the town of Portoviejo, the capital of the province of Manabi, and is a place that is full of history. This is where the members of the María Asunción Community Bank meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Karina, who is 40 years old, married, and has three children aged 20, 13 and 6.  They all live in her house and study at the university, high school and school.  Her husband is a driver.

In addition to being a great mother and wife, Karina also has a retail business. She has a store in her house where she sells large jugs of water, sodas, juices and other beverages.  In addition to selling from her house, she delivers these products using a car that she has.  At times she is assisted by one of her children, and other times she works alone.  She has been in this line of work for 6 years, and it is going very well.

She will use this loan to buy large jugs of water, sodas, juices, and other items.  She has been a member of her communal bank for more than 11 years, and she is very pleased with the help that she has received from the Fundación Espoir.

Her dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy large jugs of water, sodas, juices, etc.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is married and has two children. She is 22 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Sheryl owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stocks to sell.

Sheryl joined PMPC in 2011. In the future, Sheryl hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is married and has two children. Rudy is 60 years old, residing at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Rudy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been 18 years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Rudy has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rudy wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la ciudad de Calca en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas al noroeste de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 56 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo, ella trabaja en uno de los mejores colegios de la ciudad de Calca y enseña en el nivel secundario. Ya son 30 años que ejerce su profesión y le va muy bien. Martha también tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta de artesanía en uno de las ciudades más importantes del Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Ya son varios años que se dedica este negocio y le va muy bien. Martha en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cajas de ajedrez de piedra tallada. Su sueño de Martha es exportar a ciudades como Mexico, Estados Unidos, España y otros países.  

Martha es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Martha was born in the city of Calca in the Sacred Valley of the Incas northeast of the city of Cusco. She is 56 years old, married and has three children. She balances her household duties with her job teaching high school at one of the best schools in Calca. She has been in the profession for 30 years and it's going very well. Martha also has a small business selling crafts in one of the most important cities in the Sacred Valley. She has had the business for a number of years and it is going very well. At this time Martha is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise like carved-rock chess sets. Her dream is to export to cities in Mexico, the United States, Spain and other countries. Martha is a member of the "Virgen de Asunta de Calca" group, which consists of 15 members in Calca, province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like carved-rock chess sets.

loans.name: Enriqueta Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Enriqueta es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Enriqueta tiene 39 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 18, 17, 15, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Enriqueta se dedica a la venta de espumillas (plato típico hecho con huevo batido), esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años, también vende ropa hace 3 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a member of the village bank Divino Niño Jesús. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which in 1999 was declared an UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is beautiful and has rich natural and cultural resources; the people are friendly, polite and maintain the culture and traditions of their town.

Enriqueta, 39, is married and has 5 children, ages 18,17,15,12, and 10 years old. Her oldest three students are in high school and the other two are in middle school in the city. Her husband has a job in the private sector. The rent a house because they don't own their own.

Enriqueta has been selling espumillas (traditional meringues made with beaten eggs) for 2 years. She also has been selling clothing for 3 years, and works every day of the week without a fixed schedule.

This is her third credit with the village bank and she will invest it in clothing to stock her store. 

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.en:
Uldarico is from Balide Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old. Uldarico is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Uldarico owns and operates a business venture serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Uldarico has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 12,100 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Uldarico joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Uldarico is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food ingredients to expand his product offerings. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients to expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 31 years old and is married with one child. She is from the village of Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a store where she sells daily use products such as milk, dried fish, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Rolly has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 27,500 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rolly is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to expand her product offerings

location.town: Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive por la parroquia Paccha, lugar que se encuentra rodeada de exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones des padres.

La Señora. Ana tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y ha concebido un hijo quien es mayor de edad y trabaja para sus gastos personales. La casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Ella labora en la atención de un bar en una escuela, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 30 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes medio día. En su casa cría pollos, cuyes.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra colas, jugos, bocadillos, papas fritas, etc. para su bar.

Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the village bank Divino Niño Jesús. She lives in the parish of Paccha, a place surrounded by abundant nature. The people work in agriculture, raise animals, and many go to the city of Cuenca every day to work. They maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Ana, 56, is single and has one grown son. She works to cover her own costs of living. She owns her house.

She has worked at the snack bar at a school for 30 years. She works half days from Monday to Friday. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs at home.

This is her first loan with the village bank, which she was invited to join by her sister-in-law. She will use the money to buy sodas, juices, snacks, french fries, etc for the snack bar.

Her goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, snacks, french fries, etc.

loans.name: Mariles

texts.en:
Mariles is 48 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Sapangdalaga. To earn a living, Mariles runs a bakery. She has had this business for five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. Mariles has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Mariles is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 62 years old and is married with six adult children. She lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. To earn a living, Celia runs a type of cafeteria business called a carinderia, and she earns about 6,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months. 

Celia is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients, such as meat and assorted spices, for her carinderia. In the future, she would like to expand her business and acquire permanent location as she currently rents space.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make food

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Vergie is 57 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. To earn a living, Vergie runs a general store and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.

Vergie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchse stock for her store

loans.name: Vannet

texts.en:
Vannet is 30 years old and is married with two children. She resides with her husband and children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Vannet is a farmer and she grows bananas at her own plantation. Her husband is a driver. 

Vannet is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase rice to resell. In the future, she would like to build a warehouse to store rice in order to sell it when the price is higher. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house and support her children's education through college.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Nancy Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive por la parroquia Paccha, lugar que se encuentra rodeada de exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones des padres.

Doña Nancy tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como conserje de una escuelita, la casa en la que vive es de propiedad de su suegra, con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Nancy se dedica a tejer chompas de lana actividad que aprendió de su suegra, el producto que elabora lo vende  a sus amigas y conocidas. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos.
 
En el banco se encuentra reingresando ya que anteriormente ya era socia. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de lana para sus tejidos y alimento  para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia y un vehículo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank Divino Niño Jesús (Divine Child Jesus).  She lives in the Paccha parish, a place that is found surrounded by exuberant nature.  Its people work in agriculture and raising animals.  Many leave daily to work in the city of Cuenca at different trades.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their forefathers.

Nancy is 41 years old, married and from her marriage, she has conceived 3 children ages 17, 11, and 7.  Her eldest daughter works and helps her financially and her youngest children study in a small school in the city.  Her husband works as superintendant of a small school.  The house where they live is the property of her mother-in-law, with whom she shares household expenses.  

Nancy works weaving wool sweaters, a trade she learned from her mother-in-law.  She sells the products she makes to her friends and acquaintances.  In her home, she works raising chickens and pigs. 

She finds herself returning to the bank, since she was previously a member.  She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of wool for her weaving and food for her animals.

Her goal is to have her own home and a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase wool and food for the animals.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 29 years old and lives in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has two children. For the past 2 years, Geraldine has been selling ready-to-wear products and delivering them to her customers. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase ready-to-wear products. Geraldine  has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for ten months. In the future, Geraldine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina, 47 years old, is married and has 5 children. She lives in Señor, Sinacaban. For the past 5 years, Regina has been farming and growing vegetable crops to earn a living. Regina has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to  purchase fertilizer for planting crops. Regina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for planting crops

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 30 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Maricel has owned and operated a general store for 1 year, earning a monthly income of 2,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Maricel has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida, 48 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past 12 years, Florida has been a farmer, growing  rice and corn to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase necessary farm supplies. Florida has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 24, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey……..).

Sokhom is a fish vendor. Her husband is a fisherman and a rice farmer. Sokhom is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to transport the fish which her husband catches so she may sell them. In the future, she would like to purchase a new engine boat for her husband to go fishing and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 50 years old and lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is separated from her husband and has 4 school-aged children. Nida operates a grocery store, earning approximately PHP 7,000 each month.  She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock for her store. Nida has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Nida hopes to have enough savings to provide her children with a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: María Ubaldina

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar  de grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas algunas y modernas construcciones otras que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional, no desentonan y más bien le dan variedad al paisaje, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
Doña María tiene 69 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, todos son casados y viven independientes. Su esposo se dedica  a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora María se dedica a la agricultura, sus productos los vende y también son para su consumo. Se dedica a la cría de ganado, pollos, cuyes y cerdos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es  tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Amistad".  She lives in the Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place known for its large cattle ranches, romantic old haciendas and other modern buildings that, while not keeping with traditional architecture, are not out of place and even add variety to the landscape.  The people here are kind, polite and traditional and maintain their parents' culture.

Doña María is 69, married and has six children who are all married and independent.  Her husband is a farmer and they live in their own house.

María is a farmer who sells products and also keeps some for home consumption.  She raises cattle, chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

The communal bank is receiving its second loan which will be used to buy livestock.

Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, 47 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Gemma has been a teacher for 1 year, earning PHP 8,000 monthly. Gemma is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to pay for house renovations. In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. In the future, Gemma hopes to financially support immediate members of her family and to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to pay for house renovations

loans.name: Jojet

texts.en: Jojet is 37 years old and lives in Candanay Norte, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and has one child. Jojet has operated a business selling food everyday for 20 years, earnsing PHP 5,000 monthly.  She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase assorted spices and meat to sell. Jojet has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than a year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted spices and meat

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Ruth es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas algunas y modernas construcciones otras que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional, no desentonan del todo y más bien le dan variedad al paisaje, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
Doña Ruth tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora conduciendo maquinaria pesada, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Ruth se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para vehículos y filtros, negocio en el que se encuentra hace un año y medio y trabaja de lunes a sábados todo el día. También cría cerdos y cuyes. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de lubricantes para vehículos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es  agrandar su local y vender repuestos para vehículos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Amistad". She lives in the Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place known for its large cattle ranches, romantic old haciendas and other modern buildings that, while not keeping with traditional architecture, are not out of place and even add variety to the landscape. The people here are kind, polite and traditional and maintain their parents' culture.

Doña Ruth is 29, married and has a common-law husband and two children, ages 9 and 2.  Her eldest is in school in the city.  Her husband works as a heavy machinery driver.  They live in their own home.

Mrs. Ruth sells vehicle lubricants and filters and has been in business for a year and a half.  She works Monday through Saturday all day.  She also raises pigs and guinea pigs.

Through the communal bank she is requesting her second loan which she plans to use to buy vehicle lubricants so she can continue business.

Her goal is to expand her location and sell vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy vehicle lubricants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas for sale

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is 53 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba. She is married and has 4 children. Dionesia has been selling fish for a living for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase 20 boxes of fish to sell. Dionesia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: To purchase 20 boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 27 years old and lives in San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban. She is married and has 1 child. For the past year, Grace has operated a store, selling a variety of goods. Grace has requested a loan  of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Grace has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca,  lugar de grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas algunas y modernas construcciones otras que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional, no desentonan del todo y más bien le dan variedad al paisaje, su gente es amable, gentil y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres. 

Doña Ana tiene 66 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo labora en la agricultura y la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Ana se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, cuyes, gallinas y cerdos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra reingresando y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca.
 
Su meta es tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Amistad".  She lives in the Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place known for its large cattle ranches, romantic old haciendas and other modern buildings that, while not keeping with traditional architecture, are not out of place and even add variety to the landscape. The people here are kind, polite and traditional and maintain their parents' culture.

Doña Ana is 66, married and has a common-law husband and four children who are all adults, married and live independently.  Her husband is a farmer and they live in their own home.

Mrs. Ana raises and sells cattle, guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

She plans to use the loan to buy a cow.  Her goal is to have more livestock.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33  years old and single. She is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Roselyn owns and operates a food business, selling banana cue (caramelized, fried bananas) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. Roselyn joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients and supplies and invest in the expansion of her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her business and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Amelia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Amelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables

loans.name: Senelia

texts.en:
Senelia is 48 years old and is married with school-aged children. She lives in Lalao, San Juan, Siquijor.  Senelia runs a fish-selling business and earns 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  

Senelia is requesting a loan to purchase freshly caught fish to sell at the market. In the future, she would like to have a savings account to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Gal-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Gal-Erdene is 41 years old. He works as a taxi driver and lives with his wife and his children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Mr. Gal-Erdene has been running his business since June 2011, and he works in two shifts. The first starts at eight in the morning and finishes at three in the afternoon, and the second starts at nine in the evening and finishes at three in the morning. He has some experience and already has his own permanent customers.  However, his taxi has lately become unsuitable to run for his service as it has many damaged parts. Mr. Gal-Erdene believes this will badly influence his business. 

Mr. Gal-Erdene is requesting a loan to repair his car and purchase spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his taxi

loans.name: Gaudioso

texts.en:
Gaudioso is 55 years old and married with six adult children. He lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor, Siquijor. For the past 10 years, Gaudioso has been working as a farmer. He grows corn to earn a living. Gaudioso has been a member of Paglaum Mulit Purpose Cooperative for just one month.  

Gaudioso is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn. In the future, he hopes to have a big harvest of corn for his family's consumption and to be able to deliver corn to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic had been patiently managing her retail store for almost 20 years. She was proud enough that through her minimal income from the business, she was able to provide the needs of her family such as meals and allowances for her three children. Only one of them is currently going to school. She wanted to educate them all so she did not stop to acquire profits from her business. 

Marivic still aims to improve her sales despite the years being involved in her business. She would like to keep earning good profits. That is why Marivic wanted to take a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy groceries such as assorted biscuits, vinegar, cooking oil, eggs and soft drinks to sell and add up her profits. 

Marivic would like to meet all her customers who look for the quality of products she sells. In this matter, she would earn more profits and make progress in her current living situation.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as assorted biscuits, vinegar, cooking oil, eggs and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and married with three children. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Josephine owns and operates a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community, such as food and home products. She has been in her business for one year and earns 10,000 PHP a month. Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Josephine is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 54 years old and married. She has five children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

Oliva has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells items like soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar and spices. Oliva works hard to improve her earning. 

She requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as eggs, cooking oil and canned goods. Oliva hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, cooking oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng, 24, is married and has two young children. 

She is a local farmer from Prey Chor district. She grows rice crops on her own farm land that she inherited from her grandparents. It is located near the path of the river that provides enough water to cover her corps both in rainy season and dry season. She generates around $2.00 per day from this business. 

Yeng would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a trailer to connect with her husband’s motorcycle that can be used to provide transportation services in the commune. In particular, he transports rice for local villagers during the harvesting season. 

Yeng plans to use her additional income generated from her business to better her living conditions and improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 33 years old and has been married to Tito for almost 11 years. The couple has one child who is in college. To meet the family's daily needs, Myrna has established a small store in which she sells grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. According to her, minimal profits earned were just enough to buy food for daily meals and to provide allowances for her child. She is thankful that, despite many competitors in the retail business, she can still acquire sales and earn good profits.

With her current situation in the business, she aspires to make improvements and to provide for all of the needs of her customers. She is asking for additional capital, because she had insufficient funds to buy canned goods, soft drinks, detergents, and eggs to sell. She is now asking for 25,000 PHP.

Through the help of this loan and her patience and determination to succeed, Myrna will alleviate her family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, detergents, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children. Romeo has a shop that buys and sells bananas and corn grains. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy bananas and corn grains to sell. Romeo has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. 

In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and corn grains to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, she operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 months and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Gertrudes has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gertrudes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam, 38, sells beautification commodities such as bandeaux, earrings, etc. She has been doing her business since 2003 and has gained a lot of experience in her business field. 

She lives with her mother and her younger daughter in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her business has been running during the last several years and she has bought a car from her earnings in the last year. Now this car is used as a taxi by her husband’s business. 

Now Javzandulam needs some money to purchase more beautification commodities from her suppliers for sale during the coming holidays because during the coming traditional celebrations, there will be much more sales activity in the markets of Mongolia. It is a beneficial and big chance to increase her income for the year. 

The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and has six children. She is 45 years old and lives in Can-asagan, San Juan, Siquijor.

Gemma is engaged in the growing of pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase feeds and medicines for her pig raising business.

Gemma has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Gemma hopes to sustain her business and have savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Alita has a rice field that sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

Alita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the rice field

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 56 years old, is married and has one child. She lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Nancy has owned and operated a general store for 10 years, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Nancy earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Nancy recently joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance for her business. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Prafedes

texts.en:
Prafedes is 73 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Prafedes has a rice field that sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

Prafedes has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Prafedes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito, 48 years old, is married and has three children. Lolito lives in Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. For the past 5 years, Lolito has owned and operated farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000 from his business. Lolito has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lolito joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Lolito wants to make improvements to his house and to have his children complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Marjorie has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marjorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marjorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Marichu has a shop that makes and sells milk candies (or yema), and she is using a motorcycle for the delivery of the snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Marichu has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 52, works as a nurse in a hospital located in Kherlen, a town in Mongolia. She has had this job for 32 years and has helped many patients over this time. Oyunchimeg is a widow who lives with her daughter in a slum district. Her house has become very old and uncomfortable and urgently requires some renovations. This loan will be dedicated to purchasing some building materials needed to renovate her old house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials needed to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun, 61 years old, is married and has 5 children. She has permanently lived in Prey Chor district. Chhun and her husband have worked on their rice farming since 1980 and agriculture is her sole of income. Chhun presently owns only a few pieces of farmland for growing her rice crops and her rice yields are barely enough to meet the family's needs. She is seeking a loan from HKL, Kiva's partner, to buy stocks of rice for her daily food for the year. In the future, she hopes that she’ll be able to expand her farmland and produce a good output for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice.

loans.name: Raffy

texts.en: Raffy is married and has one kid. He is a hard-working man. His wife takes care of the home. Raffy grows crops. Mainly, he grows rice and corn, which bring in a good harvest. His loving wife helps him with his work. He also gets income by providing transportation services. He would like to use the extra money he makes on his own house. Raffy is asking for a loan to purchase rice to sow. He is grateful in advance to Kiva lenders for their support and generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm

loans.name: Reinario

texts.en:
Reinario is a 44-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has no children yet. 

Reinario has been in the business of raising pigs for three years. Reinario earns 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month raising pigs. Reinario also runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. He works hard to improve his income. He plans to use his loan to purchase piglets and feed. Reinario hopes to save for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has four children. Mercy is 51 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. Mercy has a gardening business and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this work. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Recently, Mercy joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as an additional investment in her business. In the future, Mercy wants to make improvements to her house and to finished the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Marilyn Group

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and lives in Mitugas, Tudela. Marilyn is married and has three children. 

Marilyn has a store that sells a variety of goods. Marilyn has had this business for 27 years. Marilyn requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. for her general store. 

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her store. 

Marilyn is the leader of a five person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Janice has a food shop where she sells barbecues & kebab. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue & kebabs.

Janice has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue & kebabs

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia is 57 years old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban. She is married and has four children. 

Anatalia has a general store that sells variety of goods. Anatalia has had this business for 20 years. Anatalia requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc. 

Anatalia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Anatalia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

Evangeline has a shop in which she sells fish, such as sardines, trout, and milk fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhon, age 44, has spent most of her life time cultivating rice for her livelihood. She always works alongside her husband on the existing farmland. She in now blessed with six children, one of who lives independently and has started a new family. 

At this time, for her second loan, she is asking for 3,000,000 Riel (KHR). She'll use the loan to pay for a rented plantation, on which she plans to grow her potato crops this year. With the increase in income, she'll save to buy a medium size plantation for growing potatoes and other types of crops.

loans.use: to pay for a rented plantation.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children.
 
Agustin has a shop where he sells corn grains & a variety of vegetables. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy corn grains & vegetables to sell.

Agustin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Agustin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy corn grains & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en: Lately her apartment has become very uncomfortable and cold to live in because all the window insulation has been removed and there is too much heat lost during the winter time. Therefore she needs to make adjustment and insulation to the windows of her home immediately. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the building materials to make the renovations to her home.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is married and she's from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Ruby has a business selling goods in the local community. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

Ruby is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to add additional capital of banana and barbecue vending. In 2011, Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business operated reinvest to double the earnings and plans to improve expand her business.

loans.use: to additional capital of banana and barbecue vending

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Ms Hoa is taking out this student loan for her son, An, who is attending the Informatics Technology University. His area is computer programming. When he was a child, An was keen on computers and working with them. Currently, he is studying hard to have good knowledge.
