He hopes that he will have a good job and work for a computer company in two years. During his study, his parents create favorable conditions for him to study. Currently, he wants to have a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnamese dong to pay for tuition fees and for buying supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and for buying supplies.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children.

Norman has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Norman has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Norman hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman who has three adult children. She is 43 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is operating a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. In the future, Jocelyn wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a modest person with a strong personality. She lives with her husband and children in the village of Carabatan Grande.

Aniceta is engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business she started several years ago. The best way to earn profits was to go to the livestock markets to buy and sell pigs. Now, she needs to increase her business, and this is why she is taking out a loan of 7,000 PHP that she will use to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise. This business helps Aniceta, because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Amour

texts.en:
Amour is from Quirino, Isabela and married to Vilma. The couple has four grown up children. Amour's primary source of income is planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has 1.5 hectare of land. His business is very profitable for the region. He is earning a net income of 7,000 PHP monthly for this kind of activity. 

Amour is a hard working and responsible individual. He always wanted to save some funds for the future of his family. He is not going to stop at what he has achieved, but plans to develop the business further. Amour is asking for a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm. He is hoping that lenders will approve his request because that loan is of great help for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 24, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a tailor. Her husband is teacher. Sewing is the main source of the family's income, that's why Chenda needs more funds to expand her business. This is the first time for her to request a loan of $500 to purchase cloth to sew more clothes for her clients. 

In the future, she would like to expand her sewing shop and hire few more tailors to provide a better sewing service to her clients. Moreover, she plans to decorate her house as well as her shop to be an attractive place for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sew more clothes for her clients

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann is humble resident who has been living in Prey Chor district. She is now 42 years old and a responsible mother of four children, three of whom are attending school in a province. She is completely dedicated to farming work to generate income, earning approximately $2.50 per day. 

With the loan she has applied for from Kiva, she will purchase a stock of rice from local villagers at a cheaper price to keep it for daily food during the year. For her prospects, she will strive to work harder to provide her children further education.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 31 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with two children. 

Melodia sells food every day to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 7000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase assorted ingredients for selling food in the market. 

Melodia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two months. In the future, Melodia hopes to grow her business and be able to support the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase assorted ingredients for selling food in the market

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 49 years old, married, has four children, and is from Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Joy has a business raising pigs. Joy has been raising livestock for one year & three months and she earns 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Joy is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Joy wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jovelyn has a shop that makes and sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Laila has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for four years and six months. The profits earned from her businesses allow her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to provide their daily needs. 
 
Laila wants to strengthen her business but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. In the future, Laila aims to have a large store to earn higher revenue.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed.

Jesus has a shop that sells coconuts and bananas. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Jesus has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jesus hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Aurora is a farmer who lives in the San Juan province of Isabela. He started the farming business eight years ago by planting rice. He learned from his  parents about the farming business. He is so thankful for the opportunity they gave him by teaching him in farming.

Aurora is applying for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm. Despite the challenge of seasonal weather, Aurora intends to purchase a water pump for continuous flowing of water in his rice field in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for his farm.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.

Imelda has a shop that makes and sells viands (items of food), like afritada and caldereta. She has a vegetable garden and sells vegetables during harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making viands (food items).

loans.name: Teodorica

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Teodorica is a married woman with seven children aged between 11 and 26. Teodorica's husband works as a farmer. 

Teodorica has had a sari-sari (general) store business for a year. She sells items like canned goods, cooking oil, coffee and sugar. She earns 3,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month with her business. 

Teodorica has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store and invest in another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soy sauce, and canned goods

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Rosalinda has a shop that sells coconuts and green bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en: Ni Made is borrowing a new loan from MUK to increase her business, she has a plan to buy six piglets and use the rest of the loan for feed. During this period she will maintain pigs for pig rolls (roast suckling pigs). These kinds of pigs are maintained for two months and then sold. This business really helps with her family's income. Ni Made has a dream to become the biggest pig seller in her village.

loans.use: To buy 6 piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan is 48 years old and a loving mother of three single children. She resides in the Prey Chor district of the Kompong Cham province. She is in two businesses: cultivating rice and recycling used materials. After she has just finished the bustle of her farming work, Kan intends to invest her time in collecting the recycled materials from place to place around her commune.

However, she doesn't own a motorcycle for long distance travelling. To solve that problem, she decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to make good progress in her recycling business. She'll keep the remaining funds as capital to buy recycled materials. She hopes that her business will grow and make her a good income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Corazon has a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom, 56, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. Additionally, she makes flat baskets to sell. Her children are employed at a garment factory. Since the factory is far away from home, Nom is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a separated woman and has one little angel. Joan is 21 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Joan has a piggery and a general store, selling pigs and a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been running her business for 3 years

She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase pig feeds and grocery items to sell. Joan joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Joan hopes to a motorcycle with cab use for the delivery of the domestic animal pigs to the contract buyer.

loans.use: To purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie lives at Roma Norte, Enrile with her four children. Unluckily, she was separated from her spouse due to some personal problems. Margie carries the burden alone in sustaining the needs of her children, especially for a good education. She is currently sending them to high school. 

Margie raises crops from her one hectare rice field. She pays for additional laborers to help her do farming activities. She also raises hogs to add to her income. As of now, she would like to increase her earnings and is in need for additional capital so she is now requesting for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy three bags of rice seeds and six bags of UREA (fertilizer) for use in farming.

In the future, though it is difficult to be engaged in this kind of business, Margie wants to keep growing as an successful entrepreneur to make her family live more fortunately.

loans.use: To buy three bags of rice seeds and six bags UREA (fertilizer) for use in farming.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking man. He is married and has two children. In order to acquire an income to sustain the family, he plants and harvests rice to sell upon maturity and harvest. He usually earns a yield twice per year, during the months of April and November. He would like to make his crops more productive. According to him, he needs to increase his earnings because the cost of living currently is highly expensive.

As of now, he is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) and to pay for laborers hired for land preparation. 

In the future, he would like to earn good profits every harvest season to make his family live fortunately.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pay for laborers hired for land preparation.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer living in the Philippines. He plants and harvests rice to sell. This is the business he inherited from his parents because he had only finished high school. He wasn't able to seek employment; that is why he is only involved in this kind of business. 

Richard is now 32 years old and keeps growing rice to earn an income for the sustenance of his family. He has one child. 

He is now asking for a loan to make improvements on his output. He is asking for 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

Richard would like to keep saving funds for the college education of his only child so that someday, he can earn a degree and seek good employment.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a responsible and loving father to his child and husband to his wife, Mary Ann. He is a farmer who plants rice to sell. He started raising crops three years ago. He needs to improve his farming practices, and as of now, he pays laborers to help him sow and transplant rice seedlings during the planting season.

Christopher is now asking for a loan, because he lacks the funds to pay labor costs and to buy rice seeds to grow. In this matter, he is asking for 12,000 PHP and promises to repay it on time.

With good profits from the business, Christopher also aims to renovate their small house.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en: Dewa Ayu Ketut earned a satisfying profit during the last loan period, so she decided to borrow a new loan to purchase two superior piglets. The price for one superior piglet now is 450,000 Rupiah (IDR) and the rest of the loan will be used to buy feed. All the profit is used to finance her children's education. Dewa Ayu Ketut hopes her children can have a high level of education and a better future.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Mrs. Tes is from Prey Chor district. Agriculture is a main part of what she does. She is now 56 years old and married. She has two children who always assist her on the farm. Tes grows types of crops, such as rice, pepper plants (chili), and vegetables, based on the season.

She would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a pumping machine, water pipes, and fertilizers for her chili plants. This loan will improve her business and reduce some expenses that she usually pays for her laborers. 

She is very happy and grateful for the constant support from lenders for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine, water pipes, and fertilizers for her chili plants.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is a married woman with one child. She is 24 years old and resides at Matugas, Alto, Jimenes, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Roxan owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Roxan has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Dwi Rahayu 1 Group

texts.en:
The 10 members of Dwi Rahayu 1 group are located in the village of Pesagi - Tabanan, Central Bali. The group was formed from the expansion of the service area of a branch office in Badung, which was inaugurated three months ago. Badung is the fourth branch of MUK. Pesagi - Tabanan is a rural area where the inhabitants work as farmers. To increase the family income, they want to get training on pig raising and lending funds from MUK. So far, they only maintain local pigs and to increase knowledge about pigs, they join MUK.

Ni Made, 42, was appointed as head of the group and is responsible for the business loans of the members. The total loan for the group is Rp 35,000,000 and Ni Made receives Rp 3,500,000. The loan will be used to buy superior quality piglets, to buy food and to fix the cage. She hopes her efforts will go smoothly and no pigs will die. She plans to use the profits to improve her homes. Ni Made is in the back row, number one from the right, in a pink shirt.

loans.use: To buy superior quality piglets, buy food and fix the cage

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business on which Alfredo and his family rely upon for their income during the harvest seasons of April and November. He usually makes a net profit of P10,000 from his half-hectare rice field. 

Alfredo is married and has one child. He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy pesticides and fertilizers used in farming. He would like to improve his crop production to alleviate his family from their poor financial condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers used in farming

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy appears in the photo with her husband at the side of her own house, located in Prey Chor district. She is 40 years old and has been blessed with three children. Two of her children are already married and live separately, while the other one now is working as a construction worker around the province. 

Thy generates her income by cultivating rice and potato crops on the existing farmland. Now her potato crops are ripe enough to harvest, yet she doesn’t have sufficient funds to hire a few physical laborers to help. Thus, she is looking for a loan from HKL to pay for the labor costs. 

She is an honest client who successfully paid back her previous loans. This is her third loans from HKL and second loan from Kiva as well.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She needs to look after her parents who live with her as well. She is a tailor. Her husband is a secondary school teacher. 

Yoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase cloth to sew more clothes for her clients in the market. 

In the future, she plans to expand her sewing work into embroidery work to earn more profit, renew her house, and support her children to study until they get Bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sew more clothes for her clients.

loans.name: Bong

texts.en:
Mrs. Bong is a 43-year-old single parent who has been living in Kompong Cham province. To generate her income, she has been involved in cultivating rice crops. She has five children, one of whom works as a laborer in Korea in order to support the family and provide a good education for his younger brothers and sisters.  

Bong is now taking out a loan of $500 to buy a stock of cashew nuts from her local villagers’ plantations. This project will create a good income for the family later.

She will use the increase in her income to expand her businesses. She hopes to uplift her family out of poverty some day as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.en:
Apolonio is 48 years old and married to Saturnina. They have six children. Two of them attend school. The rest have settled into marriage and live separately from them but sometimes still rely on their parents when financial crises arise. 

As of now, Apolonio's farming business is generating a good income but he still aspires for a better crop production so that he can further help his children when they come to him for help. He is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. He hopes to make his business more profitable to achieve financial independence and someday lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она трудолюбивая, талантливая и умная женщина. Она  работает парикмахером. Она имеет свой салон красоты. Более 23 лет она занимается  этим бизнесом, имеет работников и еще одну точку в другом районе города. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и хотела бы получить займ для покупки основных средств. Она хочет открыть еще одну точку и нуждается в вашей поддержке. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en:
Lola is married and a loving mother of three children. She is a hardworking, talented and intelligent woman. She works as a hairdresser. She owns her own beauty salon. She has been in this business for over 23 years, and has employees and an additional salon in another part of town. 

Lola wants to expand her business and would like to get a loan for the purchase of fixed assets. She wants to open yet another salon and needs your support. She thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Leonisa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Leonisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand started to raise crops when he got married 10 years ago. He owns a hectare rice field which he cultivates planting rice. He learned the skills of raising crops from his father who is also a farmer. As of now, Ferdinand would like to keep making more sales from his business but he has insufficient working capital so he is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Ferdinand would like to earn enough funds for the college education of his four children so that they can be professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is married and has 2 children. He is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Michael is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years, and every month he earns PHP2,500 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to repair the existing vehicle for better service.

Michael has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Michael hopes to help his children finish their studies, and to gain double income out from his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Rona has a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Estrella has a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old. She is married to Jovito, a farmer in the village of Carabatan Grande. They are thankful because they have been blessed with five children.

To make a living, Gemma is engaged in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. The net profit she generates from her business is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. Therefore she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from the hog-raising business; she also buys and sells vegetable in the village.

To improve her business, Gemma is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and additional pigs to raise and to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell. Gemma says that the loan she receives will be very helpful in the success of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional pigs to raise, and to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Wayan and the other members of the Anyar Sari 1 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Wayan hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Wayan will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs.  With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a cow breeder.  Ultimately, Ni Wayan hopes that the increased income will enable her to renovate the kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 
Rodulfo has a pig pen and sells grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Rodulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Alma has a food shop (or sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
